titleStmt.title: A Lexicon of the Homeric Dialect: revised.
titleStmt.author: Richard John Cunliffe

monogr.author: Richard John Cunliffe
monogr.title: A Lexicon of the Homeric Dialect.

div.p: With voc. of δειλός. See δειλός 3.a, 3.b.
[perh., with ἀ-1 for ἀν-1, ἀάϝατος, fr. ἀϝάω. See ἀάζω.]
Thus, not liable to ἄτη, that cannot be taken in vain, unimpeachable, decisive: ἆάατον στυγὸς ὕδωρ Il. 18.271: ἄεθλον ἀάατον Od. 21.91, ἄεθλος ἀάατος Od. 22.5.
To smite with blindness of the mind, infatuate, make reckless Il. 21.237: Od. 10.68, Od. 11.61, Od. 21.296, 297.
So in mid.: Ἄτη (Ἄτην) ἣ πάντας ἀᾶται Il. 19.91, 129.
In mid., to be so smitten, be made infatuated or reckless: ἀασάμην Il. 9.116, 119, Il. 19.137. Cf. Il. 9.537, Il. 11.340, Il. 19.95.
[app., with ἀ- for ἀ-1, fr. ἅπτω.]
Thus, not to be touched, irresistible: χεῖρες (χεῖρας) Il. 1.567, Il. 21.450, Il. 11.169, Il. 13.49, Od. 3.503, etc.: Od. 11.502, Od. 22.70, 248.

div.head: ἄασε, ἀάσθη
div.p: 3 sing. aor. act. and pass. ἀάζω.
Not to be restrained, ungovernable: μένος Il. 5.892.
3 sing. pres. mid. ἀάω. See ἀάζω.
Except in Il. 22.218 in contr. form ἆτος.
Hence, to be ignorant, fail in recognition Od. 4.249.
App., feeble, weak, gentle: χεῖρα Il. 5.337, τείχεα Il. 21.178: θάνατος Od. 11.135, Od. 23.282.
With genit., to miss, fail of meeting: ἀλλήλοιιν Il. 10.65.
Absol.: τοῖς ἀγαθοῖσιν Od. 15.324, οὐκ ἀγαθοῖσιν Od. 18.383 (v. l. οὐτιδανοῖσιν).
Warlike, soldierly, stout, skilful in fight Il. 1.131, Il. 4.181, Il. 7.478, Il. 13.314, etc.
Absol.: ἀγαθοῖσι μάχεσθαι Il. 13.238. Cf. Il. 21.280 (twice), etc.
Passing into 4: ἀ. πάϊς Ἀλκινόοιο Od. 8.130, 143.
Good, worthy, serviceable, skilled: ἰητῆρε Il. 2.732. Cf. Il. 3.179, 237, Il. 13.666, Il. 23.770: πὺξ ἀγαθόν Od. 11.300.
In moral sense, good, of right feeling: ἀ. καὶ ἐχέφρων Il. 9.341.
Of the mind, showing discretion, good judgment or discernment, well-balanced: φρεσὶ κέχρητ' ἀγαθῇσιν Od. 3.266. Cf. Od. 14.421, Od. 16.398, Od. 24.194.
Sim. φρεσὶ μαίνεται οὐκ ἀγαθῇσιν Il. 21.360.

Of things or abstractions, good of their kind, good, excellent, fine, helpful, in place, or the like: βουλάς Il. 2.273, ὄψιν (his fair . . .) Il. 24.632. Cf. Il. 9.627, Il. 11.793 = Il. 15.404, Il. 23.810: βίον (pleasant) Od. 15.491. Cf. Od. 9.27, Od. 13.246, Od. 15.405, 507, Od. 17.347, 352, Od. 24.249, 286.

div.head: a
div.p: A good or desirable thing Il. 2.204.
With infin.: ἀ. νυκτὶ πιθέσθαι Il. 6.282 = 293. Cf. Il. 24.130, 425: Od. 3.196.

div.head: b
div.p: What is good, good: ἀ. τελέσειεν Od. 2.34. Cf. Od. 4.237, 392, Od. 21.63.
So εἰπεῖν εἰς ἀ. (for the general good) Il. 9.102, πείσεται εἰς ἀ. (for his own good) Il. 11.789.

div.head: a
div.p: So εἰς ἀ. φρονέων Il. 23.305. Cf. Il. 24.173: Od. 1.43.

div.head: b
div.p: What is morally right: ἀ. φρονέοντα Il. 7.162.
Very famous, glorious, splendid, worthy Il. 16.738, Il. 17.716, Il. 21.379 Il. 23.529.
To exult in, take delight in.
With dat.: πτερύγεσσιν Il. 2.462, πώλοισιν Od. 3.222. Cf. Od. 5.176, Od. 7.272.
An ornament, a glory or delight Il. 4.144: Od. 4.602, Od. 4.300, Od. 19.257.
Of things offered to the gods: πόλλʼ ἀγάλματʼ ἀνῆψεν Od. 3.274. Cf. Od. 3.438, Od. 8.509, Od. 12.347.
Fut. infin. ἀγάσεσθαι Od. 8.565, Od. 13.173. ἀγάσσεσθαι Od. 4.181.
3 sing. aor. ἠγάσσατο Il. 3.181. ἀγάσσατο Il. 17.71: Od. 4.658.
To wonder, marvel: οἵ κʼ ἀγασσάμενοι οἶον ἐπόρσειαν Il. 6.41 (admiring his chivalry; or perh. in sense 3, grudging him honour): ἀγάσσατο θυμός Od. 4.658. Cf. Od. 16.203, Od. 18.71.
To be jealous, bear a grudge Il. 14.111, Il. 23.639.
With dat. of person: οἱ Il. 17.71: Od. 5.122, ἡμῖν Od. 8.565, Od. 13.173.
With complementary infin.: θεαῖς ἀγάασθε παῤ ἀνδράσιν εὐνάζεσθαι Od. 5.119. Cf. Od. 5.129, Od. 23.211.
To be offended or hurt Od. 23.175.
To be indignant or offended at: κακὰ ἔργα Od. 2.67. Cf. Od. 23.64.
With dat. of person: εἴ πέρ μοι ἀγάσσεαι Od. 1.389.
Gentle, mild, affectionate: ἐπέεσσιν Il. 2.164, 180, 189, Il. 24.772: ἀ. καὶ ἤπιος Od. 2.230=Od. 5.8, μύθοις Od. 15.53.
Soothing, effecting propitiation, winning acceptance: δώροισιν Il. 9.113, εὐχωλῇσιν 499: Od. 13.357.
Of the shafts of Apollo and Artemis, bringing painless death Il. 24.759: Od. 3.280 = Od. 15.411, Od. 5.124 = Od. 11.173 = 199.
Gentleness of disposition, mildness Il. 24.772: Od. 11.203.
Of gentle disposition, mild: ἀνήρ Od. 3.467.
In mid.: οὐδ' ἀγαπαζόμενοι φιλέουσιν Od. 6.33. Cf. Od. 17.35 = Od. 22.499, Od. 21.224.
To play the host to: ὰθάνατον θεόν Il. 24.464.
To be contented: οὐκ ἀγαπᾷς δ . . ; Od. 21.289.
Beloved, darling Il. 7.401: Od. 2.365, Od. 4.727, 817, Od. 5.18.
Epithet of the Hellespont Il. 2.845, Il. 12.30.

Of persons, an epithet of general commendation, noble, illustrious, or the like: κήρυκες Il. 3.268. Cf. Il. 5.277, Il. 6.386, Il. 11.1, Il. 17.284, Il. 19.281, Il. 24.251, etc.: μνηστῆρες Od. 2.209. Cf. Od. 2.308, Od. 7.55, Od. 11.213, Od. 13.272, etc.

A message, news, tidings: ἀλεγεινῇ Il. 2.787, ἐμὴν ἀγγελιην (about me) Il. 19.337. Cf. Il. 6.416, Il. 15.174, etc.: πατρός (about your father) Od. 1.408. Cf. Od. 1.414, Od. 2.30, Od. 14.374, Od. 24.48, etc.
In cognate acc.: ἀγγελίην ἐπὶ τυδῆ στεῖλαν (dispatched him on a message; ἐπί adverbial. ( ἐπί I.4)) Il. 4.384, ἀγγελίην ἐλθόντα (having come on a message) Il. 11.140.

In genit. denoting scope of action: σεῦ ἕνεκʼ ἀγγελίης (on a message concerning thee) Il. 3.206, ἀγγελιης τευ (on a message concerning someone) Il. 13.252, ἀγγελίης οἴχνεσκεν (used to go with messages) Il. 15.640.
(In the last five passages the word is also taken as a masc. ἀγγελίης = ἄγγελος.)
To bear a message or order, make an announcement or communication Il. 8.398, 409, Il. 9.617, Il. 11.185, Il. 19.120, Il. 24.77 = 159: Od. 16.150.
With dat. and complementary infin.: Πριάμῳ λύσασθαι Il. 24.145: κείνοις οἶκόνδε νέεσθαι Od. 16.350.
Sim. with dat. and ὅττι Il. 22.439.
To announce, communicate Il. 10.448, Il. 15.159, Il. 17.701: Od. 23.22.
With dat. and complementary infin.: ἄμμι θωρήσσεσθαι Il. 11.715. Cf. Il. 18.167, Il. 24.194.
Sim. with dat. and ὅ Od. 12.374.
Of birds of augury Il. 24.292, 296, 310: Od. 15.526.
[imp. sing. and pl. of ἄγω used interjectionally.]

div.head: a
div.p:
Elliptically: δεῦρ' ἄγε Od. 8.145, 205, Od. 12.184.– δεῦτ' ἄγε Od. 8.11.– ἀλλ' ἄγε δεῦρο Il. 11.314, Il. 17.179: Od. 9.517, Od. 11.561, Od. 22.233.–
εἰ δ' ἢ ἄγε δεῦρο Il. 17.685, Il. 23.581.

div.head: b
div.p: With 1 sing. subj., come, I will . . . : ἀλλʼ ἄγ' ἐξείπω Il. 9.60. Cf. Od. 20.296, etc.– ἀλλ' ἄγε δή Od. 13.215.– εἰ δ' ἢ ἄγε Od. 9.37, Od. 24.336.

div.head: c
div.p: Elliptically: ἀλλʼ ἄγε δεῦρο θεοὺς ὲπιδώμεθα Il. 22.254.

div.head: d
div.p: With fut.: ἀλλʼ ἄγε πειρήσομαι Od. 7.126. Cf. Od. 13.344, 397.– ἀλλ' ἄγε δή Od. 3.351, Il. 21.60: Od. 10.286, Od. 13.215.– εἰ δ(ὴ) ἄγε Il. 1.524, Il. 23.579: Od. 21.217.

div.head: e
div.p: Introducing a question: ἀλλʼ ἄγε Il. 6.36: Od. 19.24.

div.head: b
div.p: With sing.: ἀλλʼ ἄγετ' ἐπαρξάσθω Od. 21.263.

div.head: d
div.p: With 1 sing.: ἀλλʼ ἄγετʼ ὲνείκω Od. 22.139.
Aor. ἤγειρα Il. 17.222: Od. 2.41. ἄγειρα Od. 14.285.
Pass. 3 sing aor. ἀγέρθη Il. 4.152, Il. 22.475: Od. 5.458, Od. 24.349.
3 pl. plupf. ἀγηγέρατο Il. 4.211, Od. 3.13: Od. 11.388, Od. 24.21.
To bring or gather together, cause to assemble Il. 1.142, Il. 2.438, Il. 3.47, Il. 9.544, Il. 17.222, etc.: Od. 2.41, Od. 3.140, Od. 16.349.

In mid. and pass., to come or gather together, assemble: ἐπεὶ ἤγερθεν Il. 1.57. Cf. Il. 2.52, Il. 3.209, Il. 4.211, Il. 18.245, Il. 23.287, etc.: ἠγείροντο μάλ' ὦκα Od. 2.8. Cf. Od. 2.385, Od. 4.686, Od. 11.632, Od. 14.25 (the herd of swine), Od. 20.123 (v.l. ἐγρόμεναι fr. ἐγείρω; cf. ἐγείρω 4), etc.
In reference to things, to get together, collect: πολλά Od. 14.285. Cf. Od. 3.301, Od. 19.197.
In mid.: ἀγειρόμενοι κατὰ δῆμον Od. 13.14.
In reference to something immaterial: θυμὸς ἀγέρθη (his spirit was rallied) Il. 4.152, Il. 22.475: Od. 5.458, Od. 24.349.
Belonging to a or to the herd. Of oxen Il. 11.729, Il. 23.846: Od. 10.410, Od. 17.181 = Od. 20.251, Od. 22.299.

p.gloss: That drives or carries off the spoil.

div.p: An epithet of commendation of peoples and persons of uncertain meaning Il. 2.654, Il. 11.36, Il. 5.623, Il. 6.343, Il. 10.430, Il. 16.708, Il. 21.584: Od. 11.286.
Wonder, amazement, confusion: ἄγη μ' ἔχει Il. 21.221: Od. 3.227, Od. 16.243.

p.gloss: The quality in excess or with arrogance.

div.p: Manly, bold, courageous Il. 9.398, Il. 10.299, Il. 24.42, etc.: Od. 2.103, Od. 11.562, etc.— ;App. ironically (of Thersites) Il. 2.276.
Conveying at any rate a shade of blame (indicating the exhibition of the quality in excess or with arrogance) Il. 9.699, Il. 21.443: Od. 1.106, 144, Od. 20.160, etc.
Acc. pl. ἀγήρως Od. 6.94. Not subject to old age Il. 8.539, Il. 12.323, Il. 17.444: Od. 5.136 = Od. 6.257 = Od. 23.336, Od. 5.218, Od. 6.94.
To be wondered at, admirable: εἶδος ἀγητοί (i.e. in that only) Il. 5.787 = Il. 8.228, εἶδος ἀγητόν Il. 22.370. Cf. Il. 24.376: Od. 14.177.
In reference to domestic animals, to drive, lead, bring Od. 14.105, Od. 20.213, Od. 22.198.
To a hunting dog, to take with one Od. 17.294.
To persons, to lead, conduct Il. 18.493.
To things, to fetch, bring, carry Il. 24.784.
To take up in the arms Il. 17.722.
A fish-hook (app. (at any rate sometimes) of metal; cf. Il. 16.408) Od. 4.369 = Od. 12.332.
A bend; hence, a glen or valley Il. 18.321, Od. 3.490, Il. 22.190: Od. 4.337 = Od. 17.128.
Epithet of τόξα Il. 5.209, Il. 7.322: Od. 21.264.
Of ἅρμα (referring to the curved form of the front) Il. 7.39.

p.gloss: Armed with curved bows, bearing bows.

div.p: Epithet of the Paeonians Il. 2.848, Il. 10.428.
With curved lips; hence, with hooked beak Il. 16.428:= Od. 22.302, Od. 19.538.
The bend of the arm, the elbow Il. 5.582, Il. 10.80, Il. 11.252, Od. 3.479, Il. 23.395: Od. 14.485, 494.
An angle (of a wall): ἀγκῶνος τείχεος Il. 16.702.
To glory or take delight in something Il. 10.331.
Splendour, beauty, glory Il. 7.510 = Il. 15.267: Od. 17.310, Od. 18.180, Od. 19.82.
A source of honour or distinction: κῦδός τε καὶ ἀ. Od. 15.78 (the two words hardly to be distinguished).
In pl., personal adornments, bravery Od. 17.244.
Bearing goodly fruit: μηλέαι Od. 6.115 = Od. 11.589.

p.gloss: An epithet of commendation of somewhat indefinite meaning.

div.p: Of things or abstractions, splendid, fine, goodly, bright or the like: ἄποινα Il. 1.23, ὕδωρ Il. 2.307. Cf. Il. 1.213, Il. 2.506, Il. 6.203, Il. 19.385, Il. 23.262, etc.: ἱστόν Od. 2.109, ἔργα Od. 13.289. Cf. Od. 3.429, Od. 4.589, Od. 7.291, etc.
Of persons, goodly, fine or the like Il. 2.736, 871, Il. 11.385 (see κέρας 4), etc.: Od. 3.190, Od. 11.249, etc.
3 sing. aor. ἠγοίησε Il. 1.537, Il. 2.807, Il. 13.28: Od. 5.78.
3 sing. pa. iterative ἀγνώσασκε (contr. fr. ἀγνοήσασκε fr. ἀγνοέω) Od. 23.95.
To fail to know or recognize Il. 2.807, Il. 13.28: Od. 5.78, Od. 20.15, Od. 23.95 (continually showed that she did not recognize him), Od. 24.218.
With dependent clause, to fail to perceive something as to (a person): οὐδέ μιν ἠγνοίησεν ὅτι . . . Il. 1.537.
Of goddesses, holy, pure Od. 5.123, Od. 11.386, Od. 18.202, Od. 20.71.
Dedicated to a god, hallowed: ἑορτή Od. 21.259.
Nom. dual masc. pple. ἄξαντε Il. 7.40, Il. 16.371.
Pass. Genit. pl. fem. pres. pple. ἀγνυμενάων Il. 16.769: Od. 10.123.
3 sing. pf. subj. in pass. sense ἐάγῃ Il. 11.559.
To break, shiver, smash, shatter: ἄγη ξίφος Il. 3.367, ἆξον ἔγχος διομήδεος Il. 7.306, etc.: πρὸ κύματ' ἔαξεν Od. 5.385 (broke their force, beat them down), αὐχὴν ἐάγη Od. 10.560, etc.
Not to be known, unrecognizable Od. 13.191, 397.
To sit in assembly, hold debate Il. 2.337, Il. 4.1.
To speak or discourse in an assembly or company Il. 1.73, 253, etc.: Od. 2.24, Od. 4.773, etc.
To utter in an assembly: εὐχωλάς Il. 8.230.
To hold (an assembly): ἀγορὰς ἀγόρευον Il. 2.788.
To speak or discourse in an assembly or company Il. 1.109, Il. 2.250, Il. 6.361, Il. 12.213, etc.: Od. 1.382, Od. 2.15, 36, Od. 8.171, etc.
To utter or say in an assembly or company: ταῦτα Il. 6.357. Cf. Il. 6.359, Il. 22.377, etc.: Od. 2.184, 210, Od. 8.505, etc.
To speak or tell of, make known, expound, in an assembly or company: θεοπροπίας Il. 1.385: δήμιόν τι Od. 2.32, 44.

To speak or tell of, declare, make known, relate, recount: ταῦτα πάντα Il. 1.365. Cf. Il. 9.369, Il. 12.176, Il. 18.142, Il. 21.99: Od. 1.174, 179, Od. 3.254, Od. 4.836 (tell his fate), Od. 11.381, etc.
In pl., of a single assembly: ἀγορὰς ἀγόρευον Il. 2.788.
In pl., speaking in the assembly: ἔσχ' ἀγοράων Il. 2.275.

The place of assembly (app. used also as a place of judgment (cf. ἀγορῆθεν) and no doubt for other public purposes) Il. 1.490, Il. 2.93, Il. 6.382, 414, Il. 9.13, Il. 11.139, 807, Il. 16.387, Il. 18.245, 274, 497, Il. 19.45, 88, 173, 249: Od. 2.10, 37, 150, Od. 7.266, Od. 8.12, 109, 503, Od. 10.114, Od. 16.361, 377, Od. 17.52, Od. 20.146, 362, Od. 24.420.
In pl., app. of a single place: ἔμπληντ' ἀγοραί Od. 8.16. Cf. Od. 6.44.
From the place of assembly Il. 2.264.
From the place of judgment Od. 12.439.
To the place of assembly Il. 1.54, Il. 2.51, 207, Od. 3.4, 16: Od. 1.372, Od. 2.7, Od. 8.5, Od. 17.72.
A leader, commander, chief Il. 3.231, Il. 4.265, Il. 5.217, Il. 12.61, Il. 13.304, Il. 23.160, etc.
The palm of the hand; or perh., one's grasp Il. 11.425, Il. 13.508 = Il. 17.315, Il. 13.520 = Il. 14.452.
Dwelling in the fields: βοός Il. 10.155, Il. 17.521, Il. 23.684, 780, Il. 24.81, ποιμένες Il. 18.162: πόιες Od. 10.410, βοός Od. 12.253, Od. 22.403.
Only in imp. ἄγρει followed by an imp. Come!: ἀ. ἔπορσον Il. 5.765, ἀ. καταχεῦαι Il. 6.459. Cf. Il. 11.512, Il. 14.271: Od. 21.176.
So in pl.: ἀγρεῖτε κορήσατε Od. 20.149.
The chase, sport. Of birds of prey chasing smaller birds Od. 22.306.

Of
animals, wild, untamed Il. 3.24, Il. 4.106, Il. 8.338, Il. 9.539, Il. 15.271: Od. 9.119, Od. 14.50.
Absol. in neut. pl. ἄγρια, wild creaturesIl. 5.52.
Of men, fierce, savage, raging Il. 7.97 = 278, Il. 8.96, Il. 21.314.
Not conforming to the traditional order of society, uncivilized, barbarous, savage Od. 1.199, Od. 2.19, Od. 7.120 = Od. 9.175 = Od. 13.201, Od. 6.206, Od. 8.575, Od. 9.215, 494.
In gen., fierce, raging, ungoverned: χόλος Il. 4.23, πτόλεμος Il. 17.737. Cf. Il. 8.460, Il. 9.629, Il. 17.398, Il. 19.88, Il. 22.313: Od. 8.304.
Absol. in neut. pl. ἄγρια, fierceness: ἀ. οἶδεν (has fierceness in his heart) (see εἴδω III.12) Il. 24.41.
From the field or country: κατιόντ' ἀ. Od. 13.268, ἀ. ἐρχομένην Od. 15.428.
Of the country, rustic: ἀνέρες Il. 11.549 = Il. 15.272, λαοί Il. 11.676: βουκόλοι Od. 11.293.
Absol., a rustic or boor: νήπιοι ἀγροιῶται Od. 21.85.
To the field or country Od. 15.370, 379, Od. 21.370.
Haunting the fields or country: νύμφαι Od. 7.106.
So in pl.: ἀγρῶν (at the farm) Od. 4.640.
In sing., the country: ἀγρῷ (in the country) Il. 5.137: ἐπ̓ ἀγροῦ ((drawn up on the shore) in the country) Od. 1.185 = Od. 24.308. Cf. Od. 4.517, Od. 5.489, Od. 18.358, Od. 22.47, Od. 24.150.
[in form comp. fr. ἀγρός. Of the country (as opposed to the town).]
Epithet of Artemis, roaming the fields, the huntress Il. 21.471.
Some kind of clover or grass Od. 7.90.
[said to be the Aeolic form of ἀγορή.]
A gathering-place Il. 16.661 (where the corpses lay heaped), Il. 24.141 (cf. ἀγών 3): Od. 3.31.
Fighting at close quarters or hand to hand Il. 13.5, Il. 16.248, 272, Il. 17.165.

To within or at a short distance, near, nigh, close by: ἕστηκεν Il. 5.185, παρίστατο 570. Cf. Il. 7.405, Il. 6.188, Il. 15.442, Il. 16.114, Il. 17.338, Il. 23.304, 520, etc.: σχὼν κεφαλήν Od. 1.157 = Od. 4.70 = Od. 17.592, ἀ. [ἐστὶ] θύρετρα Od. 22.136. Cf. Od. 3.449, Od. 5.101, Od. 7.56, Od. 8.218, Od. 9.345, Od. 16.338, Od. 20.190, etc.
With dat.: τοι Il. 11.362 = Od. 3.449, οἱ Od. 3.283, σφισίν Il. 23.447.
Of the sea, deep close in shore Od. 5.413.
In close intercourse with the gods: φαίηκες Od. 5.35 = Od. 19.279. (Cf. ἐγγύθεν 2..b.)
Absol. ἐξ ἀγχιμόλοιο, from close at hand: ἰδών Il. 24.352.
In neut. sing. ἀγχίμολον as adv.

div.head: a
div.p: To within a short distance, near, nigh, close by Od. 14.410, Od. 17.260, Od. 22.205 = Od. 24.502, Od. 24.19, 386.
Applying the mind closely, sagacious: ἀγχίνοος καὶ ἐχέθρων Od. 13.332.
[perh. formed fr. *ἄγχιστις, abstract noun fr. ἄγχι. Cf. προμνηστῖνοι.]
Close together, one on another, in a heap or in heaps: κέχυνται Il. 5.141, ἔπιπτον Il. 17.361: Od. 22.118, Od. 24.181, 449.
In neut. ἄγχιστον as adv., nearest.

div.head: b

p.gloss: With regard to resemblance, most closely, very closely.

div.p: With dat.: νέστορι ἀ. ἐῴκει Il. 2.58. Cf. Il. 14.474: Od. 7.152, Od. 13.80.
With genit.: δειρῆς Il. 14.412, στήθεος Il. 23.762: ἐλαίης Od. 13.103 = 347.
With genit.: πυλάων Il. 24.709: κυκλώπων Od. 7.5.
Acc. sing. masc. pple. ἄξοντα Il. 8.368: Od. 11.623.
Infin. ἀξέμεναι Od. 23.221. ἀξέμεν Il. 23.668. ἄξειν Il. 16.832, Il. 19.298: Od. 13.212.
Aor. imp. pl. ἄξετε Il. 3.105, Il. 24.778: Od. 14.414.
Infin. ἀξέμεναι Il. 23.50. ἀξέμεν Il. 23.111, Il. 24.663.
Mid. Fut. ἄξομαι Il. 9.367: Od. 4.601, Od. 21.214.
3 pl. aor. ἄξοντο (v. l. ἄξαντο) Od. 8.545.
(ἀν-, ἀπ-, δι-, εἰσ-, εισαν-, ἐξ-, ἐπ-, κατ-, προσ-, συν-, ὑπ-, ὑπεξ-.)
To take as a prize: ἵππον Il. 23.577, ἡμίονον 662, 668. – to put (under the yoke) Il. 5.731, Il. 10.293, Il. 23.294, 300: Od. 3.383, 476, Od. 15.47.

In reference to persons, to cause to come or go, lead, conduct, take, bring, fetch Il. 1.346, 440, Il. 3.105, Il. 4.541, Il. 7.291, Il. 6.310, Il. 9.89, etc.: Od. 2.326, Od. 3.270, Od. 4.262, Od. 9.98, Od. 13.134, etc.
In reference to corpses Il. 6.418, Il. 22.392, etc. : Od. 24.419.
Of an impersonal agency: τίπτε δέσε χρειὼ δεῦρʼ ἤγαγεν; Od. 4.312.
Of fate, to lead on Il. 2.834, Il. 5.614, etc.
In reference to leading astray Il. 10.391.
To carry off (a horse) as spoil Il. 16.153.
To carry off (persons) captive: υἱόν Il. 2.231. Cf. Il. 4.239, Il. 7.426, Il. 8.166, Il. 9.594, Il. 11.112, Il. 21.36, etc.: γυναῖκας Od. 14.264, etc.
Sim. with φέρω (φέρω referring to things, ἄγω to men and cattle) Il. 5.484.
In reference to the rape of Helen Il. 24.764.
In reference to taking her back Od. 23.221.
In reference to taking back her and the spoils Il. 6.351, Il. 22.117.
In reference to carrying off Briseïs Il. 1.184, 323, 338, 391, Il. 19.273, etc.
To seizing and taking away (a γέρας) Il. 1.139.
Of a chariot, horses, etc., to bear, carry, bring Il. 5.839, Il. 11.598: Od. 7.37.
In reference to things, to fetch, bring, carry, take Il. 1.99, Il. 6.335, Il. 11.632, Il. 15.531, Il. 23.50, Il. 24.367, etc.: Od. 1.184, Od. 3.312, Od. 13.216, Od. 14.296, Od. 15.159, etc.
To bring in, import: οἶνον Il. 6.467, Il. 9.72, μέθυ Il. 6.471.
To carry off as spoil Il. 1.367.
In reference to levying compensation Od. 22.57.
To bring on, cause: πῆμα Il. 24.547: τερπωλήν Od. 18.37.
In reference to atmospheric phenomena: νέφος ἄγει λαίλαπα Il. 4.278. Cf. Il. 23.188.
To bring on (a period of time): ἦμαρ Od. 18.137, Ἠῶ Od. 23.246.
In various uses. In reference to conducting water in a channel Il. 21.262.
To direct the course of (a battle) Il. 11.721.
To cause (a ship) to take a certain direction Od. 9.495.
Of hunters, to draw (a cordon) Od. 4.792.

In pres. pple. with a finite vb., to take and . . . (cf. αἱρέω I 10, εἶμι 1.c, εἶμι 6.b, ἔρχομαι 1, 4, κίον 2, λαμβάνω 7, φέρω 6, 10): ἀνὰ δ' εἷσεν ἄγων Il. 1.311, στῆσεν ἄγων Il. 2.558. Cf. Il. 4.392, etc.: Od. 1.130, Od. 3.416, Od. 4.525, 634, Od. 15.542, etc.
For imp. sing. and pl. ἄγε, ἄγετε, used interjectionally see these words.

div.head: II
div.p: In mid. (often hardly to be distinguished from the act.).
In reference to cattle, to drive, bring Il. 8.505, 545.
To carry or take, take with one: χρυσόν Il. 9.367. Cf. Il. 16.223: εἵματα Od. 7.58. Cf. Od. 4.82, 601, Od. 10.35, 40.
In reference to corpses Il. 17.163, Il. 24.139.
To carry off captive or as spoil Il. 2.659, Il. 7.455, Il. 6.390, Il. 22.116, Il. 23.829.
In reference to Helen and the spoils Il. 3.72 = 93.
To take as a prize Il. 23.263.
To take to oneself as a wife, marry.

div.head: a
div.p: With αἴκαδε or the like: ὄκαδʼ ἄγεσθαι Il. 3.404, ἠγάγετο πρὸς δώματα Il. 16.190. Cf. Il. 9.146, etc.: Od. 7.159, Od. 21.316.

div.head: b
div.p: Without such a word Il. 18.87, Il. 22.471: Od. 14.211, Od. 21.322.

div.head: a
div.p: As in 4.a : κασιγνήτῳ γυναῖκα ἠγάγετο πρὸς δώματα Od. 15.238.

div.head: b
div.p: As in 4.b : ἄξομαι ἀμφοτέροις ἀλόχους Od. 21.214. Cf. Od. 4.10.
In reference to conducting a bride to her new home Od. 7.28.
In reference to speech, to cause to pass, utter: μῦθον δν οὔ κεν ἀνὴρ διὰ στόμʼ ἄγοιτο Il. 14.91.

div.head: a
div.p: θεῖον ἀγῶνα (the assemblage of the gods supposed to meet together to receive their worshippers) Il. 6.298, Il. 18.376.

div.head: b
div.p: An assembly brought together to view contests Il. 23.258, Il. 24.1.

div.head: c
div.p: App., the body of competitors: παντὸς ἀγῶνος ὑπέρβαλεν Il. 23.847.
A place for contests: τάδʼ ἄεθλα κεῖτʼ ἐν ἀγῶνι Il. 23.273. Cf. Il. 23.451, 495, 507, 617, 696, etc. : εὔρυναν ἀγῶνα Od. 8.260. Cf. Od. 8.200, 238, 259, 380, Od. 24.86.
In reference to the Greek ships drawn up on the beach: νεῶν (νηῶν̓ ἐν ἀγῶνι (in the gathering-place of the ships, i.e. the camp) Il. 15.428 = Il. 16.500, Il. 16.239, Il. 19.42.
Ignorance, want of experience or skill.
With complementary infin.: ἀμφιπολεύειν ὄρχατον Od. 24.244.

p.gloss: Ignorant of, not experienced or versed in.

div.p: With genit.: μάχης Il. 5.634, Il. 13.811; κακῶν Od. 12.208, πληγέων Od. 17.283.
Not shedding tears, tearless Il. 1.415 : Od. 4.186, Od. 24.61.
Inflexible. Of Hades: ἀμείλιχος ἠδʼ ἀδάμαστος Il. 9.158.
Bold, too bold: κύον ἀδεές Il. 8.423, Il. 21.481 : Od. 19.91.
Genit. ἀδελφειοῦ (for -ἀδελφεόο) Il. 5.21, Il. 7.61, Il. 6.120, Il. 13.788.
Harsh, untoward, unkind: ἀλέθρῳ Od. 4.489, φῆμιν Od. 7.273, πότμον Od. 10.245.
also written ἁδέω [prob. ἀ(σϝ)αδέω, to be displeased, fr. ἀ-1 + ἀ(σϝ)αδ-, ἁνδάνω.]

p.gloss: To have too much of something.

div.p: In pf. pple. ἀδηκότες, sated; hence, worn-out: καμάτῳ Il. 10.312 = 399. Cf. Il. 10.98, 471: Od. 12.281.
Sim. μὴ δείπνῳ ἁδήσειεν (lest he should be disgusted with . . . ) Od. 1.134.
To the full, to satiety Il. 5.203.
So ἁ. ἐλόωσι πολέμοιο (will drive him to satiety in the matter of war, give him his fill of war) Il. 13.315. Cf. Il. 19.423: Od. 5.290.
Free from strife: πόνος (i.e. unfought) Il. 17.42.

p.gloss: App. orig. expressing quick incessant motion.

div.p: Of bees, flying in swarms Il. 2.87.
Of the heart, beating, throbbing Il. 16.481: Od. 19.516.
Of weeping, thick-coming, vehement Il. 18.316, Il. 22.430, Il. 23.17, Il. 24.747.
Of the Sirens, trilling their song Od. 23.326.
In neut. ἁδινόν, as adv., of the expression of grief, with thick-coming bursts, vehemently: στοναχῆσαι Il. 18.124: γοόωσα Od. 4.721.
Of the incessant lowing of calves Od. 10.413.
So in pl. ἁδινά: στεναχίζων Il. 23.225. Cf. Il. 24.123, 510: Od. 6.274, Od. 24.317.
So also in neut. comp. ἁδινώτερον: κλαῖον ἁ. ἤ τʼ οἰωνοί Od. 16.216.
Of sighing, with thick-coming repetitions: ἀνενείκατο Il. 19.314.
Not broken in : βοῦν Il. 10.293. Cf. Il. 23.266, 655: Od. 3.383.
-ου, τό [ἀ-1 δύω. Not to be entered.]
To engage in a contest for a prize or as a trial of strength or skill Il. 4.389, Il. 23.274, 737.
A contest as a trial of strength or skill Od. 8.108, Od. 21.117.
In pl., the material for a contest : τόξον θέμεν σίδηρόν τε, ἀέθλια Od. 21.4. Cf. Od. 21.62, Od. 24.169.
A contest for a prize or as a trial of strength or skill Il. 16.590: Od. 4.659, Od. 8.22, 133, 160, 197, Od. 19.576, Od. 21.135, Od. 22.5, etc.
In pl., a series of contests as a part of funeral rites: ἑταῖρον ἀέθλοισι κτερέϊζε Il. 23.646.
In sing., one of the contests Il. 23.707, 753 = 831.

div.head: a
div.p: In pl., fights, struggles: ἀέθλους Τρώων καὶ Ἀχαιῶν Il. 3.126.
Trials of endurance, hardships Od. 3.262, Od. 4.170.

div.head: b
div.p: A task imposed Od. 8.363, Il. 19.133: Od. 11.622, 624.
The material for a contest: καταθήσω ἄεθλον, τοὺς πελέκεας Od. 19.572. Cf. Od. 21.91.
Carrying off prizes: ἵππους Il. 9.124 = 266. Cf. Il. 11.699, Il. 22.22, 162.
Fut. pple. in mid. form ἀεισόμενος Od. 22.352.
With cognate acc.: παιήονα Il. 1.473, Il. 22.391. Cf. Il. 18.570: Od. 17.519.
Something causing marring or disfigurement Il. 24.19.
Of mean personal appearance Od. 7.242, Od. 13.402.
Shabby, worn: πήρης Od. 17.357, χιτῶνα Od. 24.228.
Mean, wretched: κοίτη Od. 19.341, δίφρον Od. 20.259.
Hard, grievous: ἀλαωτύν Od. 9.503, ἄλγος Od. 14.32.
So as to impair one's vigour Od. 8.231.
Absol.: ἀεικέα μερμηρίζων Od. 4.533. Cf. Od. 20.394, Od. 22.432.
In neut. in impers. construction : οὔ τοι ἀεικές [ἐστιν] Il. 9.70.
So with infin.: οὔ οἱ ἀεικὲς ἀνασσέμεν Il. 19.124. Cf. Il. 15.496.
Inadequate in amount or value Il. 12.435, Il. 24.594.
Shabby, worn: πήρην Od. 13.437, Od. 17.197 = Od. 18.108.
Horrid, horrifying : στόνος Il. 10.483, Il. 21.20: Od. 22.308, Od. 24.184.
Involving disgrace or degradation: πληγῆσιν Il. 2.264, ἔργον Il. 19.133, Il. 24.733.
Of the mind, not giving right guidance Od. 20.366.
In neut. ἀεικές as adv., in unseemly wise Od. 17.216.
3 pl. aor. subj. ἀεικίσσωσι Il. 16.545, Il. 19.26.
1 pl. aor. opt. mid. ἀεικισσαίμεθα Il. 16.559.
To treat in unseemly wise Od. 18.222.
To work despite upon, mutilate (a corpse) Il. 16.545, 559, Il. 22.256, 404, Il. 24.22, 54.
Contr. acc. pl. masc. pple. αἴροντας Il. 17.724.
3 sing. aor. ἤειρε Il. 10.499. ἄειρε Il. 19.386, Il. 23.730, 882.
Mid. Contr. 2 sing. aor. ἤραο Od. 24.33.

3 sing. plupf. ἄωρτο (written
also ἄορτὀ Il. 3.272, Il. 19.253.
To lift, heave, raise up: στεφάνην Il. 10.30, δέπας Il. 11.637. Cf. Il. 10.465, 505, Il. 19.380, 386, Od. 3.325, Il. 23.730, Il. 24.589, 590: ὑψόσει 240 = 340, ἀμφουδίς Od. 17.237.
To take, lift, or pick up: λᾶαν Il. 6.268. Cf. Il. 12.383, 453, Il. 14.411, 429, Il. 17.718: λᾶαν Od. 9.537, σῖτον Od. 17.335, ἄρτους Od. 18.120.
So with ἀνά: ἂν δʼ ἄρα πελέκεας ἄειρεν Il. 23.882. Cf. Il. 22.399.
To raise for action: ἔγχος Il. 8.424. Cf. Od. 3.373, Il. 23.362: Od. 9.332.
To raise (the hands) in supplication Il. 6.130: Od. 11.423.
To raise (a mast) to an erect position Od. 2.425 = Od. 15.290.
With σύν, to harness (horses) together (cf. συναείρω) Il. 10.499 (in this sense perh. a different word).
Of ships, to carry (as cargo) Od. 3.312.
Much like I.2, to take up, pick up: πέπλων ἕνʼ ἀειραμένη Il. 7.293. Cf. Il. 23.856: Od. 15.106.

To be lifted or raised up, to rise, mount: πρὸς οὐρανὸν ἄερθεν Il. 8.74, ἴρηξ ἀπὸ πέτρης ἀρθείς (mounting and poising himself) Il. 13.63: ὑπὸ κύματος ἀρθείς Od. 5.393. Cf. Od. 8.375, Od. 12.432, Od. 19.540.
Of dust, to rise in a cloud Il. 2.151, Il. 23.366.
Of horses, to bound: ὑψόσʼ ἀειρέσθην (ἀειρόμενοἰ Il. 23.501: Od. 13.83.
Of a river, to rise in a wave Il. 21.307.
Sim. of the water: κῦμα ποταμοῖο ἵστατʼ ἀειρόμενον Il. 21.327.
Of the stern of a ship, to rise to the sea Od. 13.84.
To be taken up and carried off: ἑταίρων ἀειρομένων Od. 12.249. Cf. Od. 12.255.
To be suspended, hang: μάχαιραν, ἣ πὰρ ξίφεος κουλεὸν ἄωρτο Il. 3.272 = Il. 19.253.
A ppl. form = ἀέκων1: ἀεκαζομένην μνῶνται Od. 19.133. Cf. Il. 7.458: Od. 13.277, Od. 18.135.
Against the will of, without the good will of: θεῶν ἀ. Il. 12.8. Cf. Il. 15.720: Od. 3.28, Od. 4.504, 665, Od. 5.177, Od. 7.240, 287, Od. 12.290, Od. 17.43, Od. 24.444.
Joined with ἀντία: ἀντίʼ ἀθανάτων ἀ. θεῶν Od. 1.79.
Doing violence to the will of, doing despite to: ἀ. σέθεν Od. 3.213, Od. 16.94, σεῦ ἀ. Od. 15.19.
In spite of the resistance of: αργείων ἀ. Il. 11.667.
Not having one's desire, desiring something different: Τρωσὶν ἀέκουσιν ἔδυ φάος Il. 8.487.
Acting without intention: εἰ κινήσῃ ἀ. Il. 16.264.
A whirl or cloud of dust Il. 13.334, Il. 16.374.
To despair: ἀελπτέοντες σόον εἶναι (pple. of the impf.: they had been in despair of his safety) Il. 6.310.
To increase, enlarge, strengthen: μένος Il. 7.261. Cf. Il. 12.214, Il. 17.226.
To rear up to man's estate Od. 13.360.
to cherish or foster (grief) Il. 17.139: Od. 11.195, Od. 17.489, Od. 24.231.
To cause to prosper, bless (a farm) Od. 14.65, Od. 15.372.
To cause to be brought forth or produced:

div.head: a
div.p: Of spirit, to grow, wax: ἀέξεται θυμός Od. 2.315.
Of wrath, to increase in violence Il. 18.110.
Of a wave, to swell up, rise: οὔ ποτʼ ἀέξετο κῦμα Od. 10.93.

div.head: b
div.p: To grow up to man's estate: νέον ἀέξετο Od. 22.426.

div.head: c
div.p: Of a farm, to prosper Od. 14.66.

div.head: d
div.p: Of the day, to grow towards noon: ἀέξετο ἦμαρ Il. 8.66 = Il. 11.84: = Od. 9.56.
Not working or exerting oneself, idle, lazy Il. 9.320: Od. 19.27.
Applied to ἵπποι in sense chariot (see ἵππος 3) Il. 18.532.
In pl.: ἑπόμην ἀεσιφροσύνῃσιν (in (childish) thoughtlessness) Od. 15.470.
[perh. fr. weak stem ἀϝε- of ἄ(ϝ)ημι + -σι- + φρήν. Cf. ἄημι 3.]
Thus, subject to gusts of passion Od. 21.302.
Blown about in mind; hence, weakened in will, volatile, flighty Od. 3.183, Il. 23.603.
Dried up, dry: βῶν Il. 6.239, δρῦς Il. 11.494, οὔρεος Od. 3.491: ὕλης Od. 9.234.
App., dry dirt or mould Od. 22.184.
-ές [prob. for ἀδια(σ)εχής, fr. ἀ-1 + δια- 6 + (σ)εχ-, ἔχω. Thus neg. of διεχής, separate, and = συνεχής.]
In neut. ἀζηκές as adv., incessantly, continuously Il. 4.435, Il. 15.658: Od. 18.3.
To reverence, stand in awe of, respect Il. 1.21, Il. 5.434, 830: Od. 9.200, Od. 17.401 (τό γε, to that point.).
With infin., to shrink from doing something: λείβειν οἶνον Il. 7.267: ξείνους ἐσθέμεναι Od. 9.478.
With μή clause: μὴ νυκτὶ ἀποθύμια ἕρδοι Il. 14.261.
Infin. ἀήμεναι Il. 23.214: Od. 3.176. ἀῆναι Od. 3.183, Od. 10.25.
To blow upon (something): πόντον ἵκανον ἀήμεναι (so as to blow upon it) Il. 23.214.
In pass., to be blown upon: ὑόμενος καὶ ἀήμενος Od. 7.131.
Fig.: θυμὸς ἄητο (was blown about (by gusts of passion)) Il. 21.386.
A body of mist, a cloud: ἠέρι ἔγχος ἐκέκλιτο Il. 5.356, οἵη ἐκ νεφέων ἐρεβεννὴ φαίνεται ἀ. (app., a dark streamer of cloud detaching itself from the main body) 864, ἠέρα τύψεν Od. 3.446.
A blast or blowing (of wind) Il. 14.254, Il. 15.626 (v. l. ἀήτη,
Thus, vehement, violent, fierce: θάρσος Il. 21.395.
Of parts of the gods: κρατός Il. 1.530. Cf. Il. 13.19, Il. 14.177, Il. 16.704.
Absol. in pl., the immortals, the gods.

div.head: a
div.p: Masc. (not necessarily excluding the female divinities) Il. 1.265, Il. 2.14, Il. 5.186, Od. 8.456, Il. 19.22, etc.: Od. 1.31, Od. 3.47, Od. 4.378, Od. 6.5, Od. 14.421, etc.

div.head: b
div.p: Fem.: ὑμῖν ἀθανάτητͅσιν Il. 6.32. Cf. Il. 18.86: Od. 5.213, Od. 7.16, Od. 24.47, 55.
Absol. in masc. sing., one of the gods: ὥς τέ μοι ἀ, ἰνδάλλεται Od. 3.246. Cf. Od. 5.73, Od. 7.309.
Of a thing, of or pertaining to a god: δόμοι Od. 4.79.
Of the aegis, everlasting, indestructible Il. 2.447.
Not honoured with funeral rites: νέκυς Il. 22.386: σῶμα Od. 11.54, Ἐλπήνορα 72.
Without the good will of the gods: οὐκ ἀθεεὶ ἵκει Od. 18.353.
Absol. in neut. pl. ἀθεμίστια, what is wrong : ἀ. ᾔδη (had no regard for right in his heart, was given over to lawlessness (see εἴδω III.12): Od. 9.189. Cf. Od. 9.428, Od. 20.287.
Unworthy to share in the benefits of law: ἀφρήτωρ ἀ. ἀνέστιος Il. 9.63.
To slight, be indifferent to, think little of Il. 1.261: Od. 8.212.
Thus, not suited to the utterance of a (beneficent) god; hence, portentous, terrible, terrifying: ὄμβρον Il. 3.4, Il. 10.6: ὤρινε θάλασσαν ἀθέσφατον (so that it became . . . ) Od. 6.273.
Of winter nights, endless Od. 11.373, Od. 15.392.
Unlimited in amount: σῖτος Od. 13.244.– In number Od. 20.211.
[ἀθήρ, ear of corn = λοιγός. Consumer of ears of corn.]
App., a shovel by which grain to be winnowed was thrown against the wind ( ͂πτύον) Od. 11.128 = Od. 23.275.
With complementary pple.: βλήμενον Il. 12.391. Cf. Il. 14.334.
In one sum: ἀθρόα πάντʼ ἀποτείσεις Il. 22.271. Cf. Od. 1.43.
Collected together for use or convenience: ἀθρόα πάντα τετύχθω Od. 2.356. Cf. Od. 2.411, Od. 13.122.
Of the present: αἲ γὰρ ἡβῷμι Il. 6.132. Cf. Il. 2.371, Il. 4.189: Od. 4.697, Od. 16.99, Od. 21.372.
With infin.: αἲ γὰρ παῖδʼ ἐμὴν ἐχέμεν Od. 6.311. Cf. Od. 24.376.
subj. and κεν, and opt. and κεν in the protasis of conditional sentences = εἰ 5. For the examples and constructions see Table at end (III).

p.gloss: In final clauses, if haply, in the hope that.

div.head: a
div.p: With subj. and κεν = εἰ 10 b.β: πειρήσομαι αἴ κε τύχωμι (and see whether . . .) Il. 5.279, εἰπέμεναι ἔπος αἴ κʼ ἐθέλωσιν (i.e. ask if they will agree) Il. 6.375, πειρήσεται αἴ κε θέῃσιν (to see whether . . .) Il. 18.601. Cf. Il. 4.249, Il. 6.394, Il. 11.791, Il. 17.652, 692, Il. 19.71, Od. 3.436: εἰπέ μοι, αἴ κε γνώω (that I may see whether . . .) Od. 14.118. Cf. Od. 2.186, Od. 24.217.

div.head: b
div.p: With opt. and κεν = εἰ 10 c.β: εἰπεῖν αἴ κέ περ ὔμμι φίλον γένοιτο (and see whether . . .) Il. 6.387.
The earth: ὕδωρ ἐπικίδναται αἶαν Il. 2.850. Cf. Il. 3.243, Od. 8.1, Il. 9.506, Il. 23.742, Il. 24.695: κατέχει αἶα Od. 11.301. Cf. Od. 24.509.–

div.head: a
div.p: A particular land or country: Θρῃκῶν αἶαν Il. 13.4: Ἀχαΐδος αἴης Od. 13.249.

div.head: b
div.p: One's native land: ὁππότʼ ἂν ἧς ἱμείρεται αἴης Od. 1.41.
The surface of the earth, the earth, the ground: ὅσον τʼ ὄργυιʼ ὑπὲρ αἴης Il. 23.327.
[app. fr. αἰγ-, αἴξ. Goat-spear. Used against goats in Od. 9.156.]
A hunting-spear, a spear Il. 16.589, Il. 2.774: = Od. 4.626 = Od. 17.168, Od. 9.156.
Of a goat or goats: ἀσκῷ (of goatskin) Il. 3.247, τυρόν (of goats' milk) Il. 11.639: ἀσκῷ Od. 7.78, κυνέην Od. 24.231.
A beach or shore of the sea: ὡς ὅτε κῦμα θαλάσσης αἰγιαλῷ μεγάλῳ βρέμεται Il. 2.210. Cf. Il. 4.422, Il. 14.34: Od. 22.385.
Browsed on by goats. Of Ithaca Od. 4.606, Od. 13.246.
[sense unknown. Traditionally explained as fr. αἰγ-, αἴξ + λιπ-, λείπω, so steep as to be deserted (even) by goats.]
Of a rock: πέτρης Il. 9.15 = Il. 16.4, Il. 13.63.
Epithet of Zeus Il. 1.202, Il. 2.157, Il. 3.426, etc.: Od. 3.42, Od. 4.752, Od. 5.103, etc.
[perh. the orig. idea was that of a storm-cloud, whence the sense hurricane-wind. Cf. ἐπαιγίζω.]
The terror-striking shield of Zeus Il. 4.167, Il. 17.593.
Wielded by Athene Il. 2.447, Il. 5.738, Il. 21.400: Od. 22.297.
Lent by Athene to Achilles Il. 18.204.
Used to cover Hector's corpse Il. 24.20.
The light of the sun or moon Od. 4.45 = Od. 6.84.
The gleam of polished metal Il. 2.458, Il. 19.362.
Epithet of Olympus Il. 1.532, Il. 13.243: Od. 20.103.

App. a general name for eagles and vultures. (The αἰ. preys on live birds (Il. 17.460: Od. 22.302), but is not represented as preying on carrion. Cf. γύψ.) Il. 6.59, Il. 13.531, Il. 16.428, Il. 17.460: Od. 16.217, Od. 22.302.
3 sing. subj. αἰδέσεται Il. 9.508. αἰδέσσεται Il. 22.419.
Pple. αἰδεσθείς Il. 4.402, Il. 17.95. From αἰδ-
3 sing. aor. αἴδετο Il. 21.468: Od. 7.66, 329, Od. 8.86.

To hold in reverence or honour, pay due respect to, stand in awe of, regard, fear: ἱερῆα Il. 1.23 = 377, βασιλῆα Il. 1.331. Cf. Il. 4.402, Il. 9.508, 640, Il. 21.74, Il. 22.82, 124, 419, Il. 24.208, 503: πατροκασίγνητον Od. 7.329. Cf. Od. 9.269, Od. 14.388, Od. 16.75 = Od. 19.527, Od. 17.188, Od. 21.28, Od. 22.312 = 344.

p.gloss: To be restrained by reverence, dread or respect from doing something.

div.p: With infin.: συλεύειν Ἀχιλῆα Il. 24.435. Cf. Il. 21.468: Od. 14.146, Od. 20.343.
To be moved by regard for the feelings of, spare Od. 3.96 = Od. 4.326.
To be moved by respect for the opinion of, fear what . . . may think or say: ἀλλήλους Il. 5.530 = Il. 15.562. Cf. Il. 7.442 = Il. 22.105: Od. 2.65, Od. 8.86.

p.gloss: To be ashamed, think shame, not to like, to do something.

div.p: With infin.: ἀνήνασθαι Il. 6.93. Cf. Il. 24.90: Od. 7.66, 221.
Destroying, working destruction or harm, baneful Il. 2.455, Il. 5.880, 897, Il. 9.436, Il. 11.155: Od. 8.309, Od. 16.29, Od. 22.165, Od. 23.303.
In destructive wise, ruthlessly: κτείνεις Il. 21.220.
Absol. in pl., those who have a special claim to one's regard: αἰδοίοισιν ἔδωκα Od. 15.373.
In neut. pl., the private parts: αἰδοίων τε μεσηγὺ καὶ ὀμφαλοῦ Il. 13.568.
With due respect and regard: ἀπόπεμπον Od. 19.243.
Reverence, respect, regard: αἰδοῖ εἴκων Il. 10.238. Cf. Il. 24.111: Od. 8.480, Od. 14.505.
Sensitiveness to the opinion of others, fear of what others may think or say, shame: ἐν φρεσὶ θέσθʼ αἰδῶ Il. 13.122. Cf. Il. 15.129, 561 = 661, Il. 15.657, Il. 24.44: Od. 20.171.
As exclam. ( = ἐν φρεσὶ θέσθʼ αἰδῶ): αἰ., Ἀργεῖοι Il. 5.787 = Il. 8.228. Cf. Il. 13.95, Il. 15.502, Il. 16.422.
Something to be ashamed of Il. 17.336: Od. 3.24.
The private parts: τά τʼ αἰδῶ ἀμφικαλύπτει Il. 2.262. Cf. Il. 22.75.
Always, ever, for ever, continually, constantly, without omission or intermission:
πυραὶ καίοντο Il. 1.52, νεικεῖ με 520. Cf. Il. 1.561, Il. 2.46, 88, Il. 3.408, etc.: θέλγει Od. 1.56, κῆρ μοι τείρει 341. Cf. Od. 4.353, Od. 5.10, Od. 6.201, Od. 9.513, etc.
[cf. αἰεί, αἰέν] = αἰεί Il. 12.211, Il. 23.648: Od. 15.379.
In pass. sense, removed from sight, invisible: δράκοντʼ ἀΐζηλον θῆκεν Il. 2.318 (u.l. ἀρίζηλον).
In full bodily strength, lusty, vigorous Il. 16.716, Il. 23.432.
Blackened by smoke (failing to escape by the smoke-hole) Il. 2.415: Od. 22.239.
Of ashes, blackened by fire, dark Il. 18.23 = Od. 24.316.
With opt. : αἰ. θεοῖσι φίλος γένοιτο Il. 22.41. Cf. Il. 4.178 : αἰ. τελευτήσειεν Od. 6.331. Cf. Od. 14.440 = Od. 15.341, Od. 17.494, Od. 18.202, Od. 20.61.
Of the present: αἰ. τόσον σέο φέρτερος εἴην (would that I were . . .) Il. 16.722.
With ὤφελλον, ὤφελον, ὄφελον. See ὀφέλλω1 4.

The upper air, in which the clouds float and the meteorological phenomena take place: ἐν αἰθέρι καὶ νεφέλῃσιν Il. 15.20. Cf. Il. 8.556, 558 = Il. 16.300, Il. 11.54, Il. 15.686, Il. 16.365, Il. 18.207, 214, Il. 19.379: οὖρον ἐπαιγίζοντα διʼ αἰθέρος Od. 15.293. Cf. Od. 19.540.
Regarded as the home and realm of Zeus: αἰθέρι ναίων Il. 2.412. Cf. Il. 4.166, Il. 13.837, Il. 14.258, Il. 15.192, 610: Od. 15.523.
As the way to or from heaven: αἴγλη διʼ αἰθέρος οὐρανὸν ἷκεν Il. 2.458. Cf. Il. 17.425, Il. 19.351 : ἐξ αἰθέρος ἔμπεσε πόντῳ Od. 5.50 (on the way from Olympus).
Clear air as opposed to mist (ἀήῤ · ἐγάτη διʼ ἠέρος αἰθέρʼ ἵκανεν Il. 14.288, πολέμιζον ὑπʼ αἰθέρι Il. 17.371 (cf. 368).
A portico or covered colonnade running round the αὐλή Il. 7.243, Od. 3.11 (in the palace of Zeus), Il. 24.238 : Od. 8.57, Od. 20.176, 189, Od. 21.390, Od. 22.449.

Used as a sleeping-place for visitors : δέμνἰ ὑπʼ αἰθούσῃ θέμεναι Il. 24.644 (for Priam and the herald in the dwelling of Achilles) := Od. 4.297 (for Telemachus and Peisistratus in the house of Menelaus) = Od. 6.336 (for Odysseus in the palace of Alcinous), ἐν λεχέεσσι ὑπʼ αἰθούσῃ Od. 3.399 (of Telemachus in the house of Nestor) = Od. 6.345 (of Odysseus in the palace of Alcinous).

A portico across the gateway of the αὐλή: ὑπʼ αἰθούσῃ αὐλῆς Il. 9.472. Cf. Il. 24.323: Od. 3.493= Od. 15.146 = 191.–αἰθούσης θύρας, the gate of theαὐλή Od. 18.102 (named thus from the portico across it).
Of καπνός, fire-lit (i.e. reflecting the light of the flame below) Od. 10.152.
Born in the upper air: βορέης Od. 5.296.
App., exposure to cold air Od. 14.318.
Some kind of diving sea-bird: αἰθυίῃ ἐϊκυῖα Od. 5.337, 353.
Epithet of metals and of objects made of metal, bright, shining, gleaming: σιδήρῳ Il. 4.485, Il. 6.473, Od. 3.372, λέβητας Il. 9.123 = 265 = Il. 19.244, τρίποδας Il. 24.233: σίδηρον Od. 1.184.
Epithet of the lion tawny Il. 10.24 = 178, Il. 11.548, Il. 18.161.
Of horses, app., sorrel or brown Il. 2.839 = Il. 12.97.
In unseemly wise: σὲ κύνες ἑλκήσουσʼ ἀ. Il. 22.336.

Blood: ἔρρεεν αἷμα Il. 4.140, μεθʼ αἵματι (i.e. the bloody corpses) Il. 15.118. Cf. Il. 1.303, Il. 5.100, Il. 10.298, Il. 22.70, Il. 23.697, etc.: πεφυρμένον αἵματι Od. 9.397. Cf. Od. 11.96, 420, Od. 13.395, Od. 18.97, Od. 22.19, etc.
Race, stock: [τούτου] αἵματος εὔχομαι εἶναι Il. 7.211= Od. 3.241. Cf. Od. 4.611, Od. 16.300.
Blood relations collectively: κήδιστοι μεθʼ αἷμα 583.
In genit., by blood: οἵ θʼ αἵματος ἐξ ἐμεῦ εἰσίν Il. 19.105, οἳ σῆς ἐξ αἵματός εἰσι γενέθλης 111.
A wall, app. of stones without mortar: αἱμασιὰς λέγων (λέξοντες) (i.e. the materials for them) Od. 18.359, Od. 24.224.

div.head: a
div.p: Covered or mingled with blood, blood-stained, bloody Il. 5.82, Il. 13.393 = Il. 16.486, Il. 13.617, 640, Il. 16.841, Il. 17.298, 542, Il. 22.369: Od. 22.405.

div.head: b
div.p: As epithet of βρότος Il. 6.425, Il. 14.7, Il. 18.345, Il. 23.41.

div.head: c
div.p: Fig.: ἤματα Il. 9.326, πολέμοιο 650, πολέμου Il. 19.313.
Of the colour of blood Il. 2.267, Il. 16.459.
Bedabbled with blood, exuding blood: κρέα Od. 20.348.
To praise, commend Il. 10.249, Il. 23.552, Il. 24.30.
Absol., to approve, assent, concur: ἐπὶ δ' ᾔνεον ἄλλοι Il. 3.461. Cf. Il. 8.9: Od. 12.294 = 352, Od. 16.380 (i.e. will resent), 403, Od. 18.64.
Strengthening αἰνῶς by reduplication Il. 6.97. (The form has not been explained. Cf. οἰόθεν οἶος, μέγας μεγαλωστί.)
Doomed to an evil fate Il. 22.481: Od. 9.53, Od. 24.169.
A discourse or tale Il. 23.652: Od. 14.508.
In comp. : οὐκ αἰνότερον ἄλλο γυναικός Od. 11.427.
In superl. : στείνει ἐν αἰνοτάτῳ Il. 8.476. Cf. Il. 14.389: Od. 4.441, Od. 8.519, Od. 12.275.
Absol. in neut. pl.: αἰνὰ παθοῦσα Il. 22.431.
In neut. pl. as adv., miserably, calamitously: τεκοῦσα Il. 1.414. Cf. Od. 16.255.
In superl., most dread: αἰνότατε κρονίδη Il. 1.552 = Il. 4.25 = Il. 8.462 = Il. 14.330 = Il. 16.440 = Il. 18.361.
Of feelings, etc., extreme, sore, overwhelming: ἄχος Il. 4.169. Cf. Il. 6.215, Il. 8.449, Il. 10.312, Il. 22.94, etc. : κάματος Od. 5.457. Cf. Od. 15.342, Od. 16.87, Od. 18.274.
In neut. pl. αἰνά as adv., grievously, bitterly: ὀλοφυρόμεναι Od. 22.447.
In neut. superl. αἰνότατον as adv., very grievously or sorely: περιδείδια Il. 13.52.
Of a feeling: πόθος μʼ αἴνυται Od. 14.144.
To take for one's use, take into one's hands: ὀϊστόν Il. 15.459: τυρῶν (partitive genit.) Od. 9.225, 232. Cf. Od. 9.249, Od. 21.53.
To take away, remove, deprive of Il. 4.531, Il. 11.374, 580, Il. 13.550, Il. 21.490.
To take, select, pick out: σύντρεις Od. 9.429.
To such a degree as to cause apprehension Od. 22.136.

In reference to feelings, etc., in an extreme degree, strongly, sorely, deeply, heartily: δείδοικα Il. 1.555. Cf. Il. 5.352, Il. 7.441, Il. 8.397, Il. 9.244, Il. 10.38, 93, 538, Il. 13.165, 481, Il. 18.261, Il. 19.23, Od. 3.29, Il. 22.454, Il. 24.358: φιλέεσκεν Od. 1.264. Cf. Od. 2.327, Od. 4.441, 597, Od. 7.168, Od. 9.353, Od. 18.80, Od. 19.324, Od. 24.353.
Sim. λώβη τάδε γʼ ἔσσεται αἰ. (will be a sore . . .) Il. 6.97, αἰ. με μένος ἄνωγεν Il. 24.198.
In reference to resemblance, strangely, strikingly: αἰ. θεῇς ἔοικεν Il. 3.158. Cf. Il. 10.547: Od. 1.208.
As a gen. intensive, in a high degree, of a surety: μοχλὸς διεθαίνετο Od. 9.379, τάδε εἵματʼ ἔχω κακά Od. 17.24.

A goat: ταύρων ἠδʼ αἰγῶν Il. 1.41, ἰξάλου αἰγὸς ἀγρίου (i.e. of goat's horn) Il. 4.105. Cf. Il. 2.474, Il. 3.24, Il. 9.207, Il. 10.486, Il. 13.198, etc.: Od. 2.56, Od. 9.118, Od. 14.101, Od. 17.213, 247, Od. 18.44, etc.
To shift rapidly to and fro Od. 20.27.
Glancing, gleaming, flashing Il. 5.295, Il. 6.222, Il. 16.107.
The notion of glancing light passing into that of rapid movement. (Cf. ἀργός 2.) Of wasps: σφῆκες μέσον αἰόλοι (flexible about the middle) Il. 12.167.
Of a serpent and worms, wriggling Il. 12.208 (or this might come under (1), glistening), Il. 22.509.
Of the rapid motion of a horse's feet: πόδας αἰόλος ἵππος Il. 19.404.
Steep, sheer: μυκάλης κάρηϝα Il. 2.869. Cf. Od. 3.58: Od. 7.123.
[app. for αἰγιπόλος, fr. αἰγ-, αἴξ + -πολος, conn. with πολεύω.]
Falling steeply down, flowing fast Il. 8.369, Il. 21.9.
Of cities, set on a steep Il. 13.625: Od. 3.130= Od. 13.316, Od. 8.516, Od. 11.533.
Steep, sheer: ὄρος Il. 2.603. Cf. Il. 2.811, 829, Il. 5.367, 868, Il. 11.711, Il. 15.84: αἰπεῖα εἰς ἅλα πέτρη (running sheer down into the sea) Od. 3.293. Cf. Od. 3.287, Od. 4.514, Od. 19.431.
Applied to walls Il. 7.327, Il. 11.181: Od. 14.472.
Of a noose, hung from on high Od. 11.278.
Of cities, set on a steep Il. 2.538, Il. 9.668, Il. 15.71: Od. 3.485, Od. 10.81, Od. 15.193.
In impers. construction : αἰπύ οἱ ἐσσεῖται Il. 13.317.
Sim. of φόνος Il. 17.365: Od. 4.843, Od. 16.379.
Of the toil and moil of war, hard, daunting Il. 11.601, Il. 16.651.
Infin. αἱρησέμεν Il. 17.488, Il. 18.260. αἱρήσειν Il. 2.37, Il. 13.42.
Mid. Nom. pl. pres. pple. αἱρεύμενοι Il. 16.353.
1 pl. εἱλόμεθα Od. 9.157, Od. 11.21. ἑλόμεσθα Il. 11.730.
3 sing. ἕληται Il. 12.150, Il. 16.650, etc. : Od. 12.123.
(ἀν-, ἀποπρο-, ἀφ-, ἐξ-, ἐξαφ-, καθ-, μεθ-, συν-.)

To take, take hold of, grasp, seize : ἡνία Il. 8.319, γαῖαν Il. 11.425. Cf. Il. 5.75, 353, Il. 11.749, Il. 14.137, Il. 21.242, Il. 24.227, etc. : χεῖρα Od. 1.121. Cf. Od. 6.252, Od. 11.205, Od. 22.269, etc.
With genit. of a part grasped : κόμης Πηλεΐωνα (by the . . .) Il. 1.197. Cf. Il. 1.323, Il. 6.108, Il. 19.126, Il. 21.71, etc. : χειρὸς Ὀδυσῆα Od. 6.168. Cf. Od. 12.33, Od. 17.263, etc.
With quasi-partitive genit. : μέσσου δουρὸς ἑλών Il. 3.78 = Il. 6.56.

Of feelings, bodily or mental states, or the like, to take hold of, come to or upon, seize, affect : μή σε λήθη αἱρείτω Il. 2.34, χόλος μιν ᾕρει Il. 4.23. Cf. Il. 3.446, Il. 4.421, Il. 5.136, 862, Il. 13.581, Il. 16.805, etc. : οἶκτος Od. 2.81, θάμβος Od. 3.372. Cf. Od. 4.596, Od. 8.304, Od. 11.43, Od. 21.122, Od. 22.500, etc.
Of the darkness of death Il. 5.47, Il. 13.672 = Il. 16.607.

to take, capture, seize upon : ἑλὼν ἔχει γέρας Il. 1.356, εἴ σʼ αἱρήσει (get you in his power) Il. 24.206. Cf. Il. 7.38, Il. 10.206, 345, Il. 11.315, Il. 17.488, Il. 21.77, etc.: ἐπαΐξανθʼ ἑλέτην Od. 22.187. Cf. Od. 4.463, Od. 12.96, Od. 16.369.
To come upon, catch: με Od. 19.155.
To catch up, overtake Il. 23.345: Od. 8.330.
To take (a town): πόλιν Τρώων Il. 2.12. Cf. Il. 2.37, 141, Il. 4.406, Il. 9.129, Il. 16.153, etc.: Od. 9.165, Od. 24.377.
To take as prey: πέλειαν Il. 22.142.
To take away, remove: ἔγχος ἀπὸ χειρός Il. 15.126. Cf. Il. 2.154, Il. 5.127, etc.: Od. 8.88, Od. 19.61, Od. 21.56, etc.

To take for use or for some purpose, take into the hands: σῖτον Il. 9.216, σάκος Il. 14.9. Cf. Il. 9.656, Il. 10.335, Il. 15.474, Il. 18.416, Il. 23.839, Il. 24.93, etc.: τρίαιναν Od. 4.506, ἐπὶ πήχει ἑλών (taking it and placing it on the . . .) Od. 21.419. Cf. Od. 1.318, Od. 4.750, Od. 8.89, Od. 10.145, Od. 17.343, Od. 19.386, etc.
To draw (a person to one-self): τὴν προτὶ οἷ εἷλεν Il. 21.508. Cf. Od. 24.348.

div.head: a
div.p: To take as one's due: λέβητα Il. 23.613, βοῦν 779.

div.head: d
div.p: Of a condition of life, to come upon (one): δούλιον ἦμαρ Od. 17.323.

div.head: e
div.p: In reference to change of a person's colour: ὦχρός μιν εἷλε παρειάς Il. 3.35.

div.head: f
div.p: To take up (a lay): ἔνθεν ἑλὼν [ἀοιδὴν] ὡς . . . (from the point where . . .) Od. 8.500.

div.head: a
div.p: With διά, to separate, tear apart: διὰ δʼ ἕλε κύκλους Od. 3.280.

div.head: b
div.p: With ἐκ, to choose, select: ἐκ δʼ ἕλον χρυσηΐδα Il. 1.369.

div.head: c
div.p: With κατά, to lower: κὰδ δʼ ἕλον ἱστόν Od. 15.496.
To close (the eyes of the dead) Od. 11.426.

In aor. pple. with a finite vb., to take and . . . (cf. ἄγω I.9): γέρας ἄξω ἑλών Il. 1.139, ἑλὼν π̔ίψω Il. 8.13. Cf. Il. 3.72, 316, Il. 7.302, Il. 18.23, Il. 19.143, Il. 24.795, etc.: ξύλα δαῖον ἑλοῦσαι Od. 8.436, δὸς ἑλών Od. 17.400. Cf. Od. 4.66, Od. 8.84, Od. 9.382, etc.
To seize upon to one's own use, take away, appropriate: ἕλωμαί κε γέρας Il. 1.137. Cf. Il. 9.336, Il. 18.445, etc.
With acc. of person deprived: τήν [μʼ] ἐκ χειρῶν ἕλεθʼ ὡς εἴ τινα μετανάστην Il. 16.58.
With acc. of person deprived: οὓς ἀπʼ Αἰνείαν ἑλόμην Il. 8.108.
To take as prey: βοῶν ἐκ πῖαρ ἑλέσθαι Il. 11.550 = Il. 17.659,
To take away, remove: ἀπὸ κρατὸς κόρυθʼ εἵλετο Il. 7.472. Cf. Il. 6.122, Il. 10.458, Il. 16.663, etc.: Od. 12.199, Od. 22.271, etc.

In reference to life, strength, feelings, etc.: ἀπὸ μένος εἵλετο χαλκός Il. 3.294. Cf. Il. 5.317, Il. 9.377, Il. 11.381, Il. 17.17, etc.: ἐκ δέος εἵλετο γυίων Od. 7.140. Cf. Od. 10.363, Od. 14.405, etc.
Sim. in reference to one's home-coming: μὴ ἀπὸ νόστον ἕλωνται Il. 16.82.

To take for use or for some purpose, take into the hands: εἵλετο σκῆπτρον Il. 2.46, ἐκ δʼ ἕλετ ἰόν Il. 4.116. Cf. Il. 3.338, Il. 7.494, Il. 11.32, Il. 13.611, Il. 17.593, Il. 24.343, etc.: εἵλετʼ ἔγχος (ῥράβδον̓ (πέδιλἀ Od. 1.99, Od. 5.47, Od. 16.154. Cf. Od. 2.357, Od. 7.91, Od. 8.372, Od. 9.157, etc.
To take or carry with one: τόξον οὔ ποθʼ ᾑρεῖτο Od. 21.40.
In reference to meals, to take, partake of: δεῖπνον ἕλοντο Il. 2.399, δόρπον ἕλεσθε Il. 6.370, etc.: δόρπον ἕλοντο Od. 4.786, δεῖπνον εἵλοντο Od. 7.97, πύματον ἑλοίατο δαῖτα Od. 20.117, etc.
In reference to drink: πιέειν οὐκ εἶχεν ἑλέσθαι Od. 11.584.
To get, obtain: ἑκὼν οὐκ ἄν τις ἕλοιτο Il. 3.66, οὔ πως ἅμα πάντα δυνήσεαι ἑλέσθαι Il. 13.729, πεῖραρ ἑλέσθαι Il. 18.501.

To choose, select: εἴ κʼ ἄνδρα ἕκαστοι ἑλοίμεθα Il. 2.127, γυναῖκας ἐείκοσιν ἑλέσθω Il. 9.139. Cf. Il. 11.697, Il. 12.102, Il. 16.282, etc.: τοὺς ἄν κε καὶ ἤθελον ἑλέσθαι Od. 9.334. Cf. Od. 16.149, Od. 18.47, etc.

div.head: a
div.p: To receive, get (gifts) Od. 24.334.–(A price) Od. 14.297.–(A bride-price) μυρίʼ ἕλοντο Od. 15.367.

div.head: b
div.p: To take the benefit of, take, accept: ὕπνου δῶρον ἕλοντο Il. 6.482, Il. 9.713: Od. 16.481, Od. 19.427.

div.head: c
div.p: To agree to take, accept: ἀναίνετο μηδὲν ἑλέσθαι (refused to accept the blood-price) Il. 18.500.

div.head: d
div.p: To take or exact (an oath): εἴ κε Τρωσὶν ὅρκον ἕλωμαι Il. 22.119. Cf. Od. 4.746.

div.head: e
div.p: To take (heart): ἄλκιμον ἦτορ ἕλεσθε Il. 5.529.
contr. acc. pl. masc. pple. ἀείρω.
αἴσῃ, in the measure of, at the value of: ἐν καρὸς αἴσῃ Il. 9.378.

div.head: a
div.p: κατʼ αἶσαν, duly, fitly, properlyIl. 3.59 = Il. 7.333, Il. 10.445, Il. 17.716.

div.head: b
div.p: ὑπὲρ αἶσαν, unduly, unfitly, improperlyIl. 3.59 = Il. 7.333.
Beyond measure; hence, preponderatingly: φέρτεροι ἦσαν Il. 16.780.
A share or portion: ληΐδος αἶσαν Il. 18.327. Cf. Od. 5.40 = Od. 13.138.

One's portion or lot in life, one's fate or destiny: αἷσα τοι μίνυνθά περ (thy lot in life is but for a little time) Il. 1.416, κακῇ σʼ αἴσῃ τέκον (with an evil fate before thee) 418, κακῇ αἴσῃ τόξʼ ἑλόμην (in an evil hour) Il. 5.209, ὁμῇ πεπρωμένον αἴσῃ (having his fate fixed with a like portion before him, appointed to a like portion) Il. 15.209, πεπρωμένον αἴσῃ (with a fate, i.e.
death, before him, appointed to death) Il. 16.441 = Il. 22.179, οὔ τοι αἶσα πόλιν πέρθαι Il. 16.707, ἰῇ γιγνόμεθʼ αἴσῃ (under a like fate) Il. 22.477, εἴ μοι αἶσα τεθνάμεναι Il. 24.224, ἐν θανάτοιο αἴσῃ (a lot consisting in death, i.e. death) Il. 24.428, 750: κακῇ αἴσῃ οἴχετο (in an evil hour) Od. 19.259. Cf. Od. 5.113, 206, 288, Od. 8.511, Od. 13.306, Od. 14.359, Od. 15.276, Od. 23.315.
Sim. ἔτι ἐλπίδος αἶσα ((there is) yet a portion for hope, room for hope) Od. 16.101, Od. 19.84.
Fate that comes upon or overtakes one, evil fate, doom, death: αἴσῃ ἐν ἀργαλέῃ φθίσει Il. 22.61. Cf. Od. 9.52, Od. 11.61.
Fate or destiny as decreed by a god: ὑπὲρ Διὸς αἶσαν Il. 17.321.
So αἶσα alone, the decrees of fate (cf. μοῖρα 7): ὑπὲρ αἶσαν Il. 7.487.
This and (2) ((due) measure or estimation, (fitting) place in a scale of honour) app. blended: τετιμῆσθαι Διὸς αἴσῃ Il. 9.608.
To breathe or gasp out: θυμόν Il. 16.468, Od. 3.403.

In (due) measure: ἀμείνω αἴσιμα πάντα Od. 6.310, Od. 15.71, τίσειν αἴσιμα πάντα (all that is fitting) Od. 8.348, ἔργα (inspired by justice) Od. 14.84, ταῦτʼ αἴσιμα εἶπας (just, right) Od. 22.46, φρένας αἰσίμη (well balanced in . . .) Od. 23.14.
Absol. in neut. pl. αἴσιμα, what is just or right: αἰ. παρειπών Il. 7.62, Il. 6.121.
So (see εἴδω III.12) ὅτʼ ἄγγελος αἰ. εἰδῇ (can say the right thing) Il. 15.207: αἰ. εἰδώς (having justice in his heart, just) Od. 2.231 = Od. 5.9, αἰ. ᾔδη Od. 14.433.
In neut. pl. as adv., in due measure Od. 21.294.
Decreed by fate, fatal: αἴσιμον ἦμαρ. See ἦμαρ 4.a.
In neut. sing. αἴσιμον in impers. construction, (it is) fated or destined: μὴ ἡμῖν αἰ. εἴη φθίσθαι Il. 9.245. Cf. Il. 15.274, Il. 21.291, 495: Od. 15.239.
Showing moderation, gentle, courteous; or perh., of good omen (cf. ἐναίσιμος 2): ὁδοιπόρον Il. 24.376.
(ἀν-, ἀπ-, ἐπ-, μετ-, παρ-, προσ-, ὑπ-.) In all moods, to rush, fly, dart, of persons, animals, or things.

div.head: b
div.p: In mid.: ἀμφὶ δέ τʼ ἀΐσσονται Il. 11.417, πυλάων ἀντίον ἀΐξασθαι Il. 22.195.

div.head: c
div.p: In pass.: ἔγχος ἠΐχθη Il. 11.368, ἐτώσιον ἀϊχθῆναι Il. 5.854, ἐς οὐρανὸν ἀϊχθήτην Il. 24.97.

div.head: a
div.p: In act., to rise to speak Il. 18.506 (the notion of quickness not here to be pressed).
Of disembodied spirits, to flit about Od. 10.495.
Of the mind, to be projected in thought Il. 15.80.
Of chariots, to be tossed (into the air) Il. 23.369.
Of smoke, to rise into the air Od. 10.99.

div.head: b
div.p: In mid., of a horse's mane, to stream Il. 7.510 = Il. 15.267.

div.head: c
div.p: In pass., of reins, to slip (from the hands) Il. 16.404.
To cause to vanish or disappear Od. 20.79.
In pass., to vanish, disappear Od. 10.259.
Absol. in neut. pl. αἴσυλα, what is unjust, unseemly, or evil: αἰ. ῥέζων Il. 5.403. Cf. Od. 3.202 = 433, Il. 21.214: Od. 2.232 = Od. 5.10.
[app. αἶσα + μνη-, μνάομαι. One who is mindful of justice.]
In pl., stewards of games Od. 8.258.
The most ill-favoured or ugly: ἀνήρ Il. 2.216.
A cause or occasion of shame or disgrace Od. 18.225.
In pl., shameful deeds: αἴσχεα πόλλʼ ὁρόων Od. 1.229.
In pl., insults, reproaches Il. 3.242, Il. 7.351, 524: Od. 19.373.
Absol. in neut. αἰσχρόν, a shame, a disgraceIl. 2.119, 298.
Of words, insulting, reproachful Il. 3.38 = Il. 7.325, Il. 13.768, Il. 24.238.
With insult or reproach: ἐνένιπεν Il. 23.473: Od. 18.321.
To disfigure, mar, spoil the beauty of Il. 18.24, 27.
To mar, mutilate Il. 18.180, Il. 22.75, Il. 24.418.
To bring shame upon, act unworthily of: γένος πατέρων Il. 7.209.
To put to shame, discredit: ἐμὴν ἀρετήν Il. 23.571.–to throw blame upon Od. 2.86.
In pass., to feel shame, hesitate: δείσας αἰσχυνόμενός τε Od. 6.305. Cf. Od. 18.12.
To feel shame at the prospect of, hesitate to incur: αἰσχυνόμενοι φάτιν ἀνδρῶν Od. 21.323.
To ask for, request: ἵππους Il. 5.358. Cf. Il. 13.365, Il. 24.292: Od. 10.17, Od. 20.74.
With acc. of the person from whom something is asked: ᾔτεέ με δεύτερον Od. 9.354, αἰτήσων φῶτα ἕκαστον (to ask alms from . . .) Od. 17.365.
With infin., to ask to. . .: σῆμα ἰδέσθαι Il. 7.176.
With acc. and infin.: ᾐτέομεν θεὸν φῆναι τέρας Od. 3.173.
With double acc. of person and thing: ᾔτεέ μιν δόρυ Il. 22.295. Cf. Od. 2.387, Od. 24.85, 337.
To ask for, collect: κειμήλια Od. 19.273.
Absol., to make a request Od. 4.651.
To ask as alms: ἀκόλους Od. 17.222, σῖτον 558.
To ask alms from Od. 17.346 = 351, 502, Od. 20.179.
Absol., to ask alms Od. 17.228, Od. 20.182.

Blameworthy, to blame: οὔ τί μοι αἴτιοί εἰσιν Il. 1.153. Cf. Il. 3.164, Il. 13.111, 222, Il. 15.137,
Il. 19.86, 410, Il. 21.275, 370: οὐκ ἀοιδοὶ αἴτιοι, ἀλλὰ Ζεὺς αἴτιος Od. 1.348. Cf. Od. 2.87, Od. 8.311, Od. 11.559, Od. 22.155.
With genit.: αἰ. πάντων (for everything) Od. 22.48.
To throw (the spear): αἰχμὰς αἰχμάσσουσιν Il. 4.324.
The point of a spear: ἀνεγνάμφθη οἱ αἰ. Il. 11.348. Cf. Il. 4.461, Il. 5.293, 658, Il. 11.237, Il. 16.115, Il. 17.600, Od. 3.416, etc.
A spear: αἰχμὰς αἰχμάσσουσιν Il. 4.324, εὐήκεος Il. 22.319. Cf. Il. 12.45, Il. 13.504 = Il. 16.614, Il. 13.562, Il. 14.423.
Spearmanship, the spear: αἰχμῆς ἐῢ εἰδώς Il. 15.525.
Also αἰχμητά͂ Il. 5.197 (prob. orig. a voc. turned into a nom.).
A spearman as opposed to warriors otherwise armed: Ἄβαντες ἕποντο, αἰχμηταί Il. 2.543.

With implied notion of stoutness or skill: αἰχμητὴν ἔθεσαν θεοί Il. 1.290. Cf. Il. 3.49, Il. 5.197, 602 = Il. 16.493 = Il. 22.269, Il. 5.706, Il. 6.281, Il. 11.739, Il. 12.128, Il. 13.171: χεῖρας αἰχυητὴν ἔμεναι καὶ ἐπίφρονα βουλήν (in strength of hands and wise counsel) Od. 16.242. Cf. Od. 2.19.

Straightway, forthwith, at once, quickly, soon: αἰ. μάλʼ ἐλθέ Il. 4.70. Cf. Il. 1.303, Il. 2.664, Il. 5.242, Il. 7.370, Il. 8.127, Il. 12.369, Il. 17.116, etc.: αἰ. δεῖπνον ἕλοντο Od. 9.86. Cf. Od. 1.392, Od. 2.292, Od. 4.283, Od. 15.193, Od. 16.359, etc.
Quick: ἀγορήν (quick to disperse) Il. 19.276: = Od. 2.257, αἰψηρὸς κόρος γόοιο (soon comes on one) Od. 4.103.

div.head: ἀΐω1.
div.p: 3 sing. impf. ἄϊε Il. 10.532, Il. 21.388. ἄ͂ϊε Il. 11.463.
To perceive, see: οὐκ ἀΐεις ὅτι . . .; Od. 18.11.

div.head: a
div.p: To hear: ἄϊε Ζεύς Il. 21.388. Cf. Il. 23.430: Od. 10.118, Od. 24.415.

div.head: b
div.p: With acc. of what is heard: κτύπον Il. 10.532. Cf. Il. 15.130, Il. 18.222.

div.head: d
div.p: With genit. of person heard: ἰάχοντος Il. 11.463.
To have seen or heard, have learned, know (cf. ἀκούω 5): οὐκ ἀΐεις ὡς . . .; Il. 10.160. Cf. Il. 15.248: Od. 1.298.
One's lifetime, one's life: μινυνθάδιος αἰ. ἔπλετο Il. 4.478 = Il. 17.302. Cf. Il. 9.415: Od. 5.152.
Life, the state of being in life: ἀπʼ αἰῶνος ὤλεο Il. 24.725.

The animating principle, the vital spirit, the soul, the life, life, one's life (cf. θυμός I.1.b): λίποι μʼ αἰ. Il. 5.685. Cf. Il. 16.453, Il. 19.27, Il. 22.58: αἰῶνος εὖνιν Od. 9.523. Cf. Od. 5.160, Od. 6.224, Od. 18.204.
[sense unknown. Traditionally explained as fr. ἀ-1+ κακός, the guileless, or fr. ἀκέομαι, the healer.]
(Prob. orig. a voc. turned into a nom.)
neut. pl. of ἀκαλός, cited in sense peaceful, still (cf. ἀκή(ν) + (σ)ρέω.]
Tireless. Of a river, ever-flowing, always full: Il. 16.176.
Of a boar, untiring, steady in fight Il. 16.823.
Of the sun, regular in his course Il. 18.239, 484.
Epithet of fire, steadily or fiercely blazing Il. 5.4, Il. 15.598, 731, Il. 16.122, Il. 18.225, Il. 21.13, 341, Il. 23.52: Od. 20.123, Od. 21.181.
To cause grief to, grieve: ἀκάχησε τοκῆας Il. 23.223.

In pass., to be grieved, troubled, or borne down, to grieve or sorrow: ὡς μὴ ἀκαχήμενος εἴη Il. 5.24, θεοὶ ἀκαχήατο Il. 12.179. Cf. Il. 5.364, Il. 17.637, Il. 18.29, Il. 19.312, 335: ὁρόων ἀκάχημαι Od. 8.314. Cf. Od. 4.806, Od. 9.62 = 105 = 565 = Od. 10.77 = 133, Od. 10.313, Od. 13.286, Od. 15.481, Od. 19.95, Od. 20.84, Od. 23.360.
With genit. of what is grieved for: ἀκαχήμενον ἵππων Il. 11.702. Cf. Il. 24.550.
To cause grief to, grieve, trouble, vex Od. 16.432.
In pass., to be grieved or troubled, grieve, sorrow: μὴ λίην ἀκαχίζεο Il. 7.486. Cf. Od. 11.486.
Furnished with a sharp point: δούρατα Il. 12.444. Cf. Il. 17.412, Il. 21.72.
Withdat. expressing the material: ὀξέϊ χαλκῷ Il. 10.135 = Il. 14.12 = Il. 15.482: = Od. 1.99 = Od. 15.551 = Od. 20.127.
Furnished with a sharp (double) edge: πέλεκυν (φάσγανον̓ ἀμφοτέρωθεν ἀκαχμένον Od. 5.235, Od. 22.80.
Also (Il. 16.29: Od. 14.383) ἀκείομαι (ἀκεσίομαι, fr. ἀκεσ-, ἄκος).
To make good a blunder: ἀλλʼ ἀκέσασθε Od. 10.69.
Sim. ἀλλʼ ἀκεώμεθα Il. 13.115 (app., let us heal the breach between Achilles and Agamemnon).
A means of cure, a remedy: ἀκέσματʼ ὀδυνάων Il. 15.394.
That can be healed: ἀκεσταὶ φρένες ἐσθλῶν Il. 13.115 (app., are open to propitiation).
Undistracted by speech of others: δαίνυσθαι ἀκέοντε Od. 14.195. Cf. Od. 2.311.
Silent (indeclinable): Ἀθηναίη ἀκέων ἦν Il. 4.22 = Il. 8.459.
Without funeral rites: ἐξαπολοίατʼ ἀκήδεστοι Il. 7.60.
With genit.: εὑ Il. 14.427, μευ Il. 23.70.
Not honoured with such rites Il. 24.554: Od. 24.187.
In silence, without speech: ἴσαν Il. 4.429.
Silent: ἔσαν Od. 2.82, Od. 4.285, ἔμεναι Od. 21.239 = 385.
Of wine, pure, unmixed Od. 9.205 (app. by confusion with ἄκρητος).
Lifeless: βέλος ἀκήριον τίθησιν Il. 11.392. Cf. Il. 21.466.
Spiritless: δέος Il. 5.812, 817, Il. 13.224, ἥμενοι ἀκήριοι Il. 6.100.
App., of less account, less to be regarded Od. 5.217, Od. 8.169, Od. 18.130.
Without strength, feeble: ὀλίγος (κακὸς) καὶ ἀ. Od. 9.515, Od. 21.131.
Absol. in neut. pl. ἀκίχητα, the unattainableIl. 17.75.
In neut. ἀκλεές as adv. = ἀκλειῶς 1: ἥμενοι Il. 6.100.
(So as to be) the subject of no tidings: παῖδʼ ἀνηρείψαντο θύελλαι ἀκλέα Od. 4.728.
In inglorious wise: μὴ ἀ. ἀπολοίμην Il. 22.304.
So that no tidings come: ἀ. μιν ἅρπυιαι ἀνηρείψαντο Od. 1.241 = Od. 14.371.
Having no (considerable) portion of land: ἀνδρί Od. 11.490.
With genit.: σίτοιο Il. 19.163, πόσιος καὶ ἐδητύος 320.
In its prime, flourishing: θάμνος ἐλαίης Od. 23.191.
[prob. conn. with ἄκανθα in sense spine, prickle.]
A husband, one's husband Il. 15.91: Od. 5.120, Od. 21.88.
Lack of tendance or care: ἄλη τʼ ἀκομιστίη τε Od. 21.284.
3 sing. aor. ἀκόντισε Il. 4.496, Il. 5.533, Il. 8.118, Il. 13.183, Il. 17.304, etc.
Genit. sing. masc. pple. ἀκοντίσσαντος Il. 4.498, Il. 15.575.
Infin. ἀκοντίσσαι Il. 13.559, 585, Il. 16.359. ἀκοντίσαι Od. 22.263.
To throw the spear: ἀνδρὸς ἀκοντίσσαντος Il. 4.498 = Il. 15.575. Cf. Il. 16.336, 359: οἱ ἓξ ἀκοντίσατε Od. 22.252. Cf. Od. 22.255, 263.
With genit. of the person aimed at: Ἕκτορος ἀκόντισεν Il. 8.118. Cf. Il. 13.502, 559, Il. 17.608.
To throw (a spear): αἰχμάς Il. 12.44, Il. 14.422: δοῦρα Od. 22.265, 272, 282.
A (skilful) spearman: υἷες ἀκοντισταὶ Ἀμισωδάρου Il. 16.328. Cf. Od. 18.262.
A contest of throwing the spear: οὐδʼ ἔτʼ ἀκοντιστὺν ἐσδύσεαι Il. 23.622.
Insatiable in, never having his or their fill of.
A cure or remedy Il. 9.250: Od. 22.481.
Disorderly, marked by turbulence: ἔπεα Il. 2.213.
To have barley for food, be corn-fed: ἀκοστήσας ἐπὶ φάτνῃ Il. 7.506 = Il. 15.263.
To listen to, give ear to.
With double genit. of person from whom one hears of a thing and of the thing: δαιτὸς ἐμεῖο Il. 4.343.
Dat. pl. masc. pres. pple. ἀκουόντεσσι Od. 1.352.
2 sing. fut. in mid. form ἀκούσεαι Il. 15.96.
Infin. ἀκοῦσαι Od. 2.375, Od. 4.553, Od. 12.187, Od. 17.115, etc. (ἐπ-, ἐσ-, ὑπ-.)

To hear: τέρπετʼ ἀκούων Il. 1.474. Cf. Il. 4.198, Il. 11.603, Il. 15.129,
Il. 17.245, Il. 18.35, etc.: ἐθέλω ἀκοῦσαι Od. 4.553. Cf. Od. 11.380, Od. 12.48, Od. 15.98, Od. 23.135, etc.
With dependent clause: ὡς ἐβόησας Od. 4.281.

div.head: α
div.p: With acc. of what is heard: μῦθον Il. 2.16. Cf. Il. 1.547, Il. 2.486, Il. 4.435, Il. 7.524, Il. 10.354, Il. 21.575, etc.: δοῦπον Od. 5.401. Cf. Od. 1.282, Od. 11.421, Od. 12.265, Od. 23.40, etc.

div.head: β
div.p: With this acc. and genit. of person from whom one hears: σεῦ τὸν μῦθον Il. 19.185, σεῦ κακὸν ἔπος Il. 24.767: ἄλλων μῦθον Od. 2.314. Cf. Od. 3.94 = Od. 4.324.
With this acc. and prep.: ἐκ δεσποίνης ἔπος Od. 15.374.

div.head: α
div.p: With acc. of what is heard about: κακὰ ἔργα Il. 9.595. Cf. Il. 15.96, Il. 18.53: πατρὸς βίοτον Od. 1.287. Cf. Od. 2.218, Od. 8.578, Od. 16.380, Od. 19.535.

div.head: β
div.p: With this acc. and genit. of person from whom one hears: τόδε πατρός Od. 8.564, ταῦτα καλυψοῦς Od. 12.389,

div.head: γ
div.p: With this acc. and acc. pple. expressing what is heard about a person: τοὺς εἰ πτώσσοντας ἀκούσαι Il. 6.129.

div.head: δ
div.p: With infin. so expressing: τείρεσθαι Τρῶας Il. 7.386.

div.head: ε
div.p: With prep.: Ὀδυσῆος περὶ νόστου Od. 19.270.

div.head: c
div.p: With genit. of what is heard: κωκυτοῦ Il. 22.447. Cf. Od. 12.265, Od. 21.237 = 383, Od. 21.290, 292.

div.head: d
div.p: With genit. of person heard: ὁμοκλητῆρος Il. 12.273. Cf. Il. 16.211, Il. 23.452, Il. 24.223: Od. 14.493, Od. 19.89, Od. 22.361.
So in reference to a beast: θηρός Il. 10.184.

div.head: α
div.p: With genit, and pple. in agreement, to hear a person doing or suffering something: ὀτρύνοντος Ἕκτορος Il. 15.506. Cf. Il. 1.396, Il. 21.475: τοῦ βλημένου Od. 17.492. Cf. Od. 9.497, Od. 10.221, Od. 21.210.

div.head: β
div.p: So in reference to a bird: κλάγξαντος Il. 10.276.

div.head: f
div.p: With genit. of person from whom one hears about something: ἄλλου Od. 8.491.

div.head: α
div.p: With genit. of person heard about and pple. in agreement expressing what is heard: σέθεν ζώοντος Il. 24.490. Cf. Od. 11.458, Od. 16.301.

div.head: γ
div.p: With double genit. of person from whom one hears and of person heard about and adj. in genit. joined with pple.: Ὀδυσσῆος ζωοῦ οὐδὲ θανόντος τευ ἀκοῦσαι Od. 17.115.

div.head: δ
div.p: With genit. of person heard about omitted: τεθνηῶτος Od. 1.289. Cf. Od. 2.220, 375, Od. 4.728, 748.

div.head: ε
div.p: With this genit. alone: πατρός Od. 4.114.
To listen, hearken, give ear: θεοὶ πάντες ἄκουον Il. 8.4. Cf. Il. 12.442, Il. 17.408, Il. 19.81: ἥατʼ ἀκούοντες Od. 1.326. Cf. Od. 1.352, 353, Od. 12.37, Od. 15.393.
To listen to, give ear to.

div.head: a
div.p: With acc. of what is listened to: ἄλλων μῦθον Il. 2.200. Cf. Il. 8.492: Od. 8.429, Od. 20.389.–

div.head: α
div.p: With genit, of person, to listen to in sense of yielding or obeying: εἰπόντος Il. 7.281. Cf. Il. 15.199: Od. 2.423, Od. 19.419, Od. 22.354.
Sim., in mid., οὔ πώ σφιν ἀκούετο λαὸς ἀϋτῆς (had not attended or responded to it) Il. 4.331.

div.head: β
div.p: So in reference to hearing and answering prayer: εὐξαμένου Il. 1.381. Cf. Il. 16.531: Od. 7.325 (twice).

div.head: d
div.p: With dat. of person, to listen to favourably: ἀνέρι κηδομένῳ Il. 16.515. Cf. οἱ with εὐξαμένοιο in Il. 16.531 cited above.
To have heard, have learned, know (cf. ἀΐω1 4, πεύθομαι 3): τὰ μέλλετʼ ἀκουέμεν Il. 14.125.
With infin.: καὶ σὲ ἀκούομεν ὄλβιον εἶναι (infin. of the impf.) Il. 24.543.
With acc. of person heard about and dependent clause: Ἀτρεΐδην ἀκούετε ὡς . . . Od. 3.193.
With genit. of person from whom one has heard about something Od. 4.94.
With this genit. and clause: οὐδὲ πατρῶν ἀκούεθʼ οἷος . . . Od. 4.688.
Not accomplished, not carried out: ἔργον Il. 2.138.
Not to be fulfilled: ἔπεα Od. 19.565.
In neut. ἀκράαντον as adv., without hope of fulfilment, to no purpose Od. 2.202.
Of wind, blowing at height; or perh., blowing with the right velocity or from the right quarter Od. 2.421, Od. 14.253, 299.
The highest point of a city Od. 8.508.
κατʼ ἄκρης, down from the top. Of a breaking wave, with full forceOd. 5.313.
Fig., utterly, to total destruction: ὤλετο Il. 13.772. Cf. Il. 15.557, Il. 22.411, Il. 24.728.
A cape or headland Il. 4.425, Il. 14.36: Od. 9.285.
Unmixed: οἴνῳ Od. 24.73. Cf. Od. 2.341, Od. 9.297.
So σπονδαὶ ἄκρητοι (ratified by libations of unmixed wine) Il. 2.341 = Il. 4.159.
A hill-top: ἠνεμοέσσας Od. 9.400, Od. 16.365, διʼ ἄκριας Od. 10.281, Od. 14.2.
Indiscriminate or reckless in speech Il. 2.246.
Hard to be discerned or interpreted ὄνειροι Od. 19.560.
Endless, never brought to reconciliation: νείκεα Il. 14.205 = 304.
Absol. in neut. pl.: ἄκριτα πόλλʼ ἀγόρευον Od. 8.505 (app., held much and indiscriminate or inconsistent debate).
In neut. sing. ἄκριτον as adv.

div.head: a
div.p: Indiscriminately: ἐξαγαγόντες ἀ. ἐκ πεδίου (see ἐξάγω 2) Il. 6.337, 436.
With confused or massed foliage: ὄρος Il. 2.868 (i.e. the separate trees are indistinguishable).
In pres. pple. ἀκροκελαινιόων, of a river, with black or dark surfaceIl. 21.249.

p.gloss: Wearing the hair in a topknot (the hair round this being app. cut short or shaved off).

div.p: The summit or crest of a hill Od. 11.597.
A cape or headland. Of Sunium Od. 3.278.
An end or extremity: ἐπʼ ἄκρῳ δῆσε ζυγόν Il. 5.729. Cf. Od. 9.328, 382.
The highest part of a city, the citadel. Of Troy Od. 8.494, 504.
Topmost, the topmost part of: ὄρεσσιν Il. 5.523: Od. 19.205.

p.gloss: With a piercing or sharp point.

div.p: Outermost, the extremity of: πόδας Il. 16.640. Cf. Il. 17.264 (see ἠϊών 2), 309, 599, Od. 3.227: οἰήϊον Od. 9.483 = 540.
Growing on the extremity: τρίχες οὐραῖαι Il. 23.519.
At the end of a row: νῆες Il. 15.653.
The base or root of: χεῖρα Il. 5.336 (cf. 458).
The surface of: ὕδωρ Il. 16.162: ῥινόν Od. 22.278.
App. in neut. ἄκρον as adv., on the surface: ἀ. ἐπὶ ῥηγμῖνος θέεσκον Od. 3.229 (v. l. ἀ. ἔπι, taking ἀ. as sb., the surface; see ἄκρον 4).
In superl. ἀκρότατος, -η, -ον (in Od. 12.11 of two terminations), much like the positive.

div.head: a
div.p: Absol.: ἐπʼ ἀκροράτῃ (at the top) Il. 4.484.

div.head: b
div.p: Sim. ἀκρότατον παρʼ οὐδόν Od. 22.127 (app., to one side of (and passing at right angles) one of the extremities of the threshold).
Predicatively: ὅθʼ ἀκρότατος πρόεχʼ ἀκτή (where the beach ran furthest out) Od. 12.11.

div.head: c
div.p: The surface of: χρόα Il. 4.139, χαλκόν Il. 6.246.
Corn or meal: ἀλφίτου Il. 11.631, δημήτερος Il. 13.322, Il. 21.76: ἀλφίτου Od. 2.355, Od. 14.429.

A beach or shore of the sea: ἀκτὴν εἰσανέβαινον Il. 18.68. Cf. Il. 12.284, Od. 3.50, Il. 23.125, Il. 24.97: ἐπʼ ἀκτῆς καθήμενος Od. 5.82. Cf. Od. 5.151, Od. 10.140, 509, Od. 13.234, Od. 15.36, Od. 24.378.
A projecting part of the shore: ἀκτῇ Il. 2.395: ἀκταὶ προβλῆτες Od. 5.405. Cf. Od. 5.425, Od. 10.89, Od. 12.11, Od. 13.98, Od. 24.82.
Dat. pl. ἀκτῖσι Od. 5.479, Od. 19.441. ἀκτίνεσσι Il. 10.547: Od. 11.16.
A ray or beam: ἠελίοιο Il. 10.547. Cf. Od. 5.479, Od. 11.16, Od. 19.441.

p.gloss: Prob., the fruit of the ilex.

div.p: Used for guarding cattle or sheep Il. 11.552 = Il. 17.661, Il. 12.306: Od. 13.225.
In generalized sense, the dart: ἐπιστάμενος ἄκοντι Il. 15.282.
To or into the sea: νῆα προέρυσσεν Il. 1.308. Cf. Il. 2.165 = 181, Il. 5.598, Il. 9.358, 683, Il. 12.19, Il. 14.97, 100, 106: νῆʼ εἴρυσεν Od. 2.389.
With εἰς: ποταμῶν, οἵ τʼ εἰς ἁ. προπέουσιν Od. 10.351.
A shouting in distress: ἀλαλητῷ φεύγοντες Il. 18.149. Cf. Il. 21.10.
A shouting in war, the war-shout: ἀ. ἀνὰ στρατὸν ὀρώρει Il. 4.436. Cf. Il. 12.138, Il. 14.393, Il. 16.78.
To ward or keep off Il. 9.605, Il. 21.548, Il. 23.185: Od. 4.167.
With dat. of person protected: κύνας οἱ Il. 17.153. Cf. Il. 19.30, Il. 21.138 = 250: Od. 3.237, Od. 13.319.
With dat. and genit. of part: κρατός τοι κακὸν ἦμαρ Od. 10.288.
With dat., to succour, defend, protect: οἱ Il. 22.196.
To be distraught or sore distressed Il. 10.94.
Pple. ἀλαλήμενος Od. 13.333, Od. 14.122, Od. 17.245, Od. 21.327.
Infin. ἀλάλησθαι Od. 2.370, Od. 12.284, Od. 15.276, Od. 20.206. (ἐπ-.)
To wander, rove: κὰπ πεδίον ἀλᾶτο Il. 7.201. Cf. Il. 2.667, Il. 8.482, Il. 10.141, Il. 23.74: μαψιδίως Od. 3.72. Cf. Od. 2.333, 370, Od. 3.73, Od. 4.91, Od. 5.336, etc.
Blind: μάντιος ἀλαοῦ (for ἀλαόὀ Od. 10.493, Od. 12.267.
A negligent or careless watch or lookout: οὐδʼ ἀλαοσκοπιὴν εἶχεν Il. 10.515, Il. 13.10, Il. 14.135: Od. 8.285.
To blind: ὀφθαλμοῦ (of his (my) eye) Od. 1.69, Od. 9.516.
Weak, feeble, ineffective: στίχες Il. 4.330, σθένος Il. 5.783 = Il. 6.257, Il. 8.463: Od. 18.373.
Having little power or influence Il. 2.675.
To deprive of vigour, take the strength from: Ἀχαιούς Il. 12.67.
To ruin: Ζεὺς ἀλάπαξεν (brought all this to nought) Od. 17.424 = Od. 19.80.
To work havoc in (opposed ranks) Il. 5.166, Il. 11.503.
To destroy or sack (a city) Il. 2.367, Il. 9.136 = 278, 328, Il. 24.245.
To find things intolerable: ἠλάστεον θεοί (raged (impotently)) Il. 15.21.
So in aor. pple. ἀλαστήσας, giving way to such a feeling, breaking out in protestIl. 12.163.
Unforgettable, that never leaves one: πένθος Il. 24.105: Od. 1.342, Od. 24.423, ἄχος Od. 4.108.
In neut. ἄλαστον as adv., of mourning, without power of forgetting, unceasingly: ὀδύρομαι Od. 14.174.
Applied to a person (app. by transference of the epithet from acts to the agent), doer of deeds not to be forgotten, wretch: Ἕκτορ, ἄλαστε Il. 22.261.
To suffer (bodily) pain or discomfort Il. 2.269, Il. 8.85, Il. 12.206: Od. 12.27.

So much the worse, all the harder: ἀ. τῷ ἔσσεται Il. 18.306. Cf.
Il. 18.278: Od. 17.14, Od. 19.322.
Most difficult or hard: ἀλγίστη δαμάσασθαι Il. 23.655.
Pain, distress: ἀ. ἱκάνει θυμόν Il. 3.97. Cf. Il. 7.450, 462, Il. 18.395, Il. 22.53, 54: ὅπως μοι ἀ. ἀλάλκοις Od. 13.319. Cf. Od. 2.41, 193, Od. 15.345, Od. 19.471.
Definitely distinguished as bodily pain or suffering Il. 5.394: Od. 14.32.

In pl., distresses, woes, cares, hardships: Ἀχαιοῖς ἄλγεʼ ἔθηκεν Il. 1.2. Cf. Il. 2.667, Il. 9.321, Il. 13.346, Il. 18.224, Il. 24.568, etc.: πάθεν ἄλγεα Od. 1.4, ἄλγεσι θυμὸν ἐρέχθων Od. 5.83 (i.e. expressions of grief). Cf. Od. 2.343, Od. 3.220, Od. 8.182, Od. 20.339, etc.
To cause to wax or fill out: μέλεα Od. 18.70 = Od. 24.368.
Causing or apt to cause injury or harm: πνοιῇ βορέω Il. 14.395. Cf. Il. 17.749, Il. 24.8: = Od. 8.183 = Od. 13.91 = 264, Od. 18.224.
App., bringing repentance in its wake: μαχλοσύνην Il. 24.30.
With neg., not to care for, trouble oneself about, have regard for.
With genit.: σέθεν οὐκ ἀλεγίζω Il. 1.180. Cf. Il. 1.160, Il. 8.477, Il. 11.80, Il. 12.238.
To take one's part in, partake of (a meal): δαῖτας Od. 1.374. Cf. Od. 2.139, Od. 8.38, Od. 11.186, Od. 13.23.
To care, be concerned: οὐκ ἀλέγω Il. 11.389: Od. 17.390.
To be careful of one's duties, show due regard for another or others: ὅτις οὐκ ἀλέγει Od. 16.307. Cf. Od. 19.154.
To show concern for, busy oneself with, the right: λιταὶ ἀλέγουσιν Il. 9.504.
To attend to, busy oneself about: νηῶν ὅπλα Od. 7.268.
With neg., not to care for or concern oneself about, regard or heed: θεῶν ὄπιν οὐκ ἀλέγοντες Il. 16.388.
With genit.: σκυζομένης σευ Il. 8.483. Cf. Od. 9.115, 275, Od. 20.214.

To escape, evade, avoid, keep out of the way, reach or influence of, avoid incurring (something coming upon or threatening one): κῆρα Il. 3.32 = Il. 11.585 = Il. 13.566 = 596 = 648 = Il. 14.408, Il. 16.817. Cf. Il. 11.794, Il. 13.669, Il. 16.36, 213 = Il. 23.713, Il. 17.374: χόλον γυναικός Od. 1.433. Cf. Od. 5.326, Od. 7.273, Od. 13.148, Od. 19.373, Od. 24.229.
To elude the notice of Od. 16.477.
To shun, avoid, keep clear of or away from: πάτον ἀνθρώπων Il. 7.202. Cf. Il. 11.542, Il. 23.422.
With infin., to shrink from doing, hesitate to do: κτεῖναι Il. 7.167, ἀλεξέμεναι Il. 13.356.
An offender: τείσεσθαι ἀλείτην Il. 3.28. Cf. Od. 20.121.
Unguent, oil Il. 18.351, Il. 23.170: Od. 3.408 (app. here some kind of polish or varnish), Od. 24.45, 67, 73.
Nom. dual masc. pple. ἀλειψαμένω Il. 10.577.
To oil, anoint with oil Il. 18.350, Il. 24.582: Od. 7.227, Od. 19.505.
To stop (the ears) with wax: ἐπʼ οὔατʼ ἀλεῖψαι (ἄλειψἀ Od. 12.47, 177.
To put (wax) in the ears Od. 12.200.
In mid., to anoint oneself: ἀλείψατο λίπʼ ἐλαίῳ Il. 14.171. Cf. Il. 10.577, Il. 14.175.
Protecting from the wind: χλαῖναν Od. 14.529.
One who wards off or stems: ἀλεξητῆρα μάχης Od. 3.396.
Tending to avert evil: μῆτις Il. 10.20.
Acc. sing. masc. pple. ἀλεξήσοντα Il. 7.109.
Aor. infin. mid. ἀλέξασθαι Il. 13.475, Il. 15.565, Il. 16.562: Od. 18.62. (ἀπ-, ἐπ-.)
To ward or keep off, avert Od. 3.346.
With dat. of person or thing protected: Δαναοῖσι κακὸν ἦμαρ Il. 9.251. Cf. Il. 9.347, 674, Il. 17.365, Hom. Il. 20.315 = Il. 21.374.
With dat., to succour, defend, protect: ἀλλήλοισιν Il. 3.9. Cf. Il. 5.779, Il. 7.109.
Absol., to afford succour, defence, or protection Il. 1.590, Il. 11.469, Il. 13.356.
In mid., to ward or keep off from oneself, defend oneself against, encounter: ἀλέξασθαι κύνας Il. 13.475: τοῦτον ἀλέξασθαι Od. 18.62.
Absol., to defend oneself, offer resistance Il. 11.348 = Il. 22.231, Il. 15.565 = Il. 16.562: Od. 9.57.
3 sing. subj. ἀλέηται Od. 4.396. ἀλεύεται Od. 14.400, Od. 24.29.

To escape, evade, avoid, keep out of the way, reach, or influence of (something coming upon or threatening one): ἔγχεα Il. 7.226. Cf. Il. 3.360, Il. 5.34, Il. 15.223, Od. 3.147, 281, etc.: νοῦσον Od. 9.411. Cf. Od. 9.274, 277, Od. 12.157, Od. 16.447, Od. 20.305, 368, Od. 22.260, Od. 24.29.
To flee, take to flight, take oneself off, save oneself Il. 5.28 (as it seemed to the onlookers), Il. 13.436, 513: Od. 4.396.
To keep out of harm's way Il. 18.586.

To shun, avoid, keep clear of or away
from, refrain from: μύθους ὑπερφιάλους Od. 4.774, σειρήνων φθόγγον καὶ λειμῶνα Od. 12.159, νῆσον 269 = 274, ὅμιλον Od. 17.67.
With infin., to shrink from doing, hesitate to do: ἠπεροπεύειν Il. 23.605: Od. 14.400.
To take care not to do: λίθου ἐπαυρεῖν Il. 23.340.
A female slave employed in grinding Od. 20.105.
A means of defence: δηΐων ἀνδρῶν (against . . .) Il. 12.57, Il. 15.533.
App., not forgetting, careful, anxious: χερνῆτις Il. 12.433.
Absol. in neut. pl. ἀληθέα, the truthIl. 7.382: Od. 3.254 = Od. 16.61, Od. 13.254, Od. 14.125, Od. 17.15, Od. 18.342.
In neut. sing. ἀληθές as adv., truly Od. 3.247.
Without share of booty; hence, not rich in possessions Il. 9.125 = 267.
To go to and fro: κατὰ δῶμα Od. 17.501. Cf. Od. 22.291.
To become whole or sound: ἄλθετο χείρ Il. 5.417.
Unabating, unceasing Il. 2.797, Il. 12.471 = Il. 16.296, Il. 14.57, Od. 3.31, Il. 24.760.
In neut., ἀλίαστον as adv., without ceasing Il. 24.549.
With dat.: ἀστέρι καλῷ Il. 7.401: ἀθανάτοισιν Od. 8.174.
Of a river at its meeting with the sea Od. 5.460.

div.head: ἅλιος1,
div.p: Absol. in fem. pl., sea-goddesses Il. 18.432.

Ineffective, effecting nothing, useless, idle, vain, fruitless: πόνον Il. 4.26. Cf. Il. 4.158, 179, 498 = Il. 15.575, Il. 5.18, 715, Il. 11.376, 380, Il. 14.455, Il. 16.480, Il. 18.324, Il. 24.92, 224: ὁδός Od. 2.273, 318.
Of a person, inefficient: σκοπός Il. 10.324.
In neut. ἅλιον as adv., in vain, without result Il. 13.410, 505 = Il. 16.615.
To make of no effect, frustrate: Διὸς νόον Od. 5.104 = 138.
To use to no effect: βέλος (did not hurl it in vain) Il. 16.737.
Floating on the sea, in the state of flotsam: τείχεα Il. 12.26.
[ἅλς1 + (app.) πορφύρα, the Phoenician shell-fish called the murex, the dye got therefrom.]
Thus, dyed in sea-purple: ἠλάκατα Od. 7.53, 306, φάρεα Od. 13.108.
In a throng, in swarms: μέλισσαι ἁ. πεποτήαται Il. 2.90. Cf. Il. 3.384, Il. 22.473.

In abundance, in plenty, in great numbers: ἁ. οἱ ἦσαν ἄρουραι Il. 14.122. Cf. Il. 9.137, 279, Il. 17.54, Il. 21.236, 319, 344, 352, Il. 22.340: χαλκὸν ἁ. δόντες Od. 5.38 = Od. 23.341. Cf. Od. 2.339, Od. 6.295, Od. 13.136 = Od. 16.231, Od. 15.77 = 94, Od. 16.389 (with notion of excess), Od. 17.298, 376, Od. 24.486.
With copula to be supplied, (it is) enough: ἦ οὐχ ἁ. ὅττι . . .; Il. 5.349, Il. 23.670. Cf. Il. 9.376, Il. 17.450: Od. 2.312.
3 sing. ἁλοίη Il. 17.506. Masc. dual pple. ἁλόντε Il. 5.487.
Fem. sing. ἁλοῦσα Il. 2.374, Il. 4.291, Il. 13.816.
Infin. ἁλώμεναι Il. 21.495. ἁλῶναι Il. 12.172, Il. 21.281: Od. 5.312, Od. 24.34.
To be taken, captured, seized: βέλτερον δ'ς προφύγῃ ἠὲ ἁλώῃ Il. 14.81. Cf. Il. 5.487, Il. 11.405, Il. 21.495.
With θανάτῳ, to meet one's death Il. 21.281': = Od. 5.312, Od. 24.34.
Of towns, to be taken Il. 2.374 = Il. 4.291 = Il. 13.816, Il. 9.592: Od. 22.230.
To be slain: ἠὲ κατακτάμεν ἠὲ ἁλῶναι Il. 12.172. Cf. Il. 17.506, Il. 22.253: Od. 14.183, Od. 15.300, Od. 18.265.
Non-thematic pres. pple. mid. ἀλιτήμενος Od. 4.807.
In both voices, to sin or trespass against, fail in duty to: ἤλιτέ με Il. 9.375. Cf. Il. 19.265: ἀθανάτους ἀλιτέσθαι Od. 4.378. Cf. Od. 5.108.
In mid., to transgress, infringe: Διὸς ἐφετμάς Il. 24.570, 586.
In pres. pple. mid. ἀλιτμενος in adjectival sense, sinning, sinful: θεοῖς (in the eyes of the gods) Od. 4.807.
= ἀλιτήμων.: δαίμοσιν (in the eyes of the gods) Il. 23.595.
Not showing due regard, showing ill-will Il. 8.361.
A means of defence, a safeguard.
With dat. of person defended: τρώεσσιν Il. 5.644.
Defence, help: οὔτε κλέος οὔτʼ ἀ. Il. 5.532 = Il. 15.564, οὐδέ τις ἀ. γίγνετο (γίγνεταἰ Il. 21.528: Od. 22.305, οὐδέ τίς ἐ ἀ. Od. 12.120.

Prowess in defence or offence, mettle, courage, spirit: συΐ εἴκελος ἀλκήν Il. 4.253. Cf. Il. 3.45, Il. 5.299, Il. 6.164, Il. 9.706, Il. 16.157, Il. 19.36, etc.: ἀλκὶ πεποιθώς Od. 7.130. Cf. Od. 9.214, 514, Od. 17.315, Od. 22.226, 237, Od. 23.128, Od. 24.509.
Showing of fight, resistance: οὐκ ἀπολήγει ἀλκῆς Il. 21.578.

Prowess displayed in action, deeds of prowess,
fighting: εἰδότε ἀλκῆς Il. 11.710, ἔπαυσεν ἀλκῆς Il. 15.250. Cf. Hom. Od. 13.116, 197, Il. 15.490 (from Zeus), Od. 3.256, etc.: οὐ δεδαηκότες ἀλκήν Od. 2.61. Cf. Od. 4.527.
The upper hand, victory: ἀπείρητος οὐδ' ἀδήριτος ἤ τʼ ἀλκῆς ἤ τε φόβοιο (whether in the matter of . . . or . . . , whether the result be . . . or . . .) Il. 17.42.
With complementary infin.: ἀ. μάχεσθαι Il. 15.570.
A protector: ἀρῆς (against . . . ) Il. 14.485. Cf. Il. 18.100, 213.
A means of protection: κυνῶν Od. 14.531, Od. 21.340.
Adversative particle, but Il. 1.24, 25, 94, 116, 125, etc.: Od. 1.6, 16, 22, 42, 48, etc.

Elliptically: ἀλλ' οὐ γάρ δ' ἐθέλω . . . (but I say no more, for . . .) Il. 6.242: ἀλλ' οὐ γάρ τις πρῆξις ἐγίγνετο (but they soon gave over, for . . . ) Od. 10.202 = 568, ἀλλ' οὐ γάρ οἱ ἔτʼ ἦν ἴς ἔμπεδος (but it was of no avail, for . . . ) Od. 11.393. Cf. Od. 19.591.
Introducing an apodosis, yet, nevertheless: εἴ περ γὰρ . . . ἀλλʼ οῦ πείσονται Il. 8.154. Cf. Il. 1.82, Il. 12.349, Il. 16.38, Il. 24.771, etc.: εἰ . . . ἀλλ' ἤδη παῖς τοῖος Od. 19.86, etc.
Introducing a statement: ἀλλὰ μάλ' ὤφελλες (why . . . ) Od. 4.472.
