With imp. (or infin. as imp.) in command, challenge, entreaty, remonstrance, persuasion, encouragement, indignation, etc., nay but, come now ! ἴθι Il. 1.32, πίθεσθε Il. 1.259. Cf. Il. 1.393, Il. 1.508, Il. 1.565, Il. 2.163, 360, etc.: μέν' αὖθι Od. 2.369, ὧδ' ἔρδειν Od. 7.258. Cf. Od. 3.323, 380, Od. 4.28, 35, 379, etc.
Sim. with subj.: ἴομεν Il. 7.526, etc.: φραζώμεσθα Od. 2.167, φθεγγώμεθα Od. 10.228, etc.
With opt.: ἐπιτρέψειας ἕκαστα δμῳάων ἥ τις . . . Od. 15.24.
To pick up, gather up: ὀστέα Il. 21.321, Il. 23.253.

div.head: b
div.p: ἄλλος ἀ., one in one quarter, one in another Od. 8.516.

div.head: a
div.p: Elsewhither, in another direction Il. 1.120, Il. 5.187, Il. 15.464, Il. 21.557: Od. 2.127 = Od. 18.288, Od. 17.478.

div.head: b
div.p: In a direction other than the right: ἀ. ἀποκλίναντα (wresting the meaning) Od. 19.556.

div.head: c
div.p: ἄλλυδις ἀ., some or part in this direction, some or part in another Od. 5.369, Od. 9.458, Od. 11.385.

div.head: b
div.p: ἄλλυδις ἀ.· τρέπεται χρὼς ἄλλυδις ἀ. (now to one hue, now to another) Il. 13.279.
Unceasing, never still: ἄη νότος Od. 12.325.
In neut. ἄλληκτον as adv, without intermission or pause: πολεμίζειν Il. 2.452 = Il. 11.12 = Il. 14.152.

One another, each other: ἀλλήλοισι κέλευον Il. 2.151. Cf. Il. 3.9, 15, 115, 155, Il. 4.449, 472, 536, etc.: ξεῖνοι ἀλλήλων Od. 1.187. Cf. Od. 1.209, Od. 2.149, Od. 4.620, Od. 5.79, Od. 7.211, Od. 9.55, etc.
App., known to be other; hence, strange, foreign: δήμῳ Od. 2.366.
Absol., a foreigner or alien Il. 3.48, Il. 16.550: Od. 3.74 = Od. 9.255.
Of another, i. e. of strange, appearance: ἀλλοειδέα φαινέσκετο πάντα Od. 13.194 (ἀ. to be scanned in three long syllables; v. l. ἀλλοειδἔ ἐφάνετο).

div.head: a
div.p: From another place or source, from elsewhere: ἵνα μή ποθεν ἀ. αὕῃ Od. 5.490, καλεῖ ἀ. Od. 17.382.

div.head: b
div.p: ἀ. ἄλλος, some or one from one side or quarter, some or one from anotherIl. 2.75, Il. 9.311, 671, Il. 13.551: Od. 9.401, 493 = Od. 10.442, Od. 10.119, Od. 11.42, Od. 4.231, Od. 24.415.
Sim. νείκεον ἀ. ἄλλον, one beginning with one man, one with anotherOd. 12.392.
From another or strange land, from abroad: εἰλήλουθεν Od. 3.318. Cf. Od. 7.283, Od. 6.33, 52, Od. 16.26, Od. 17.112, Od. 20.360.
In another place, elsewhere Od. 4.684, Od. 16.44, Od. 18.401.
On his part, he too: κλαῖεν Od. 21.83.

div.head: a
div.p: In another or strange land, abroad: ἐπὴν ἀ. ὄληται Od. 14.130.–a). γαίης, elsewhere in the world, somewhere abroadOd. 2.131.

div.head: b
div.p: App., with genit., elsewhere away from (one's home): ἀ. πάτρης (i.e. in some strange land) Od. 17.318.
Speaking a strange tongue, foreign, alien Od. 1.183, Od. 3.302, Od. 14.43, Od. 15.453.
Of another sort or kind: ἔργῳ Il. 4.258: ἀ. φάνης Od. 16.181, ἄνδρα Od. 19.265.
3 sing. subj. ἅληται Il. 21.536. ἅλεται Il. 11.192, 207. (ἀνεφ-, ἐκκατεφ-, ἐξ-, ἐσ-, ἐφ-, καθ-, κατεφ-, μεθ-, ὑπερ-.)
Of an inanimate object: ἆλτ' ὀϊστός Il. 4.125.
One thing to one person, another to another, doublefaced Il. 5.831, 889.
-η, -ο. Crasis with τά gives τἆλλα Il. 1.465, Il. 2.428: Od. 3.462, Od. 12.365.

div.head: a
div.p: Another or additional person or thing: ἄλλο τοι ἐρέω Il. 1.297, οἴσομεν ἄλλον Il. 3.104. Cf. Il. 10.146, Il. 11.663, Il. 14.262, etc.: Od. 11.454, Od. 12.65, etc.
In apposition: ἄλλο τό γε οἶδα Od. 16.470.

div.head: α
div.p: Another or different person or thing, another, someone or something else: ἐγὼ ἢ ἄλλος Ἀχαιῶν Il. 2.231, πείθεόο τ' ἄλλῳ Il. 2.360. Cf. Il. 2.271, Il. 9.101, Il. 11.410, Il. 13.229, Il. 19.181 (in the case of another matter, i.e. for the future), Il. 24.46, etc.: ἄλλος εἴπεσκε νέων Od. 2.331, μεῖζον ἄλλο φράζονται Od. 4.698. Cf. Od. 3.94, Od. 4.29, Od. 8.202, Od. 11.176, Od. 13.205, Od. 17.404, etc.
With τις: ὡς ὄφελέν τις ἀνδρῶν ἄλλος ἔχειν Il. 4.316. Cf. Il. 13.272, Il. 14.90, etc.: ἄλλο τί τοι μελέτω Od. 6.208. Cf. Od. 14.461, Od. 18.334, Od. 20.297, etc.

Predicatively: ἄλλο τι τόδε μήδεαι (it is
some other thing that you are planning) Od. 5.173.
With τίς: τίς τοι ἄλλος ὁμοῖος; Il. 17.475. Cf. Il. 17.586.
With the article, the other: ἴἡ ἄλλη σῖτον ἔφερεν Od. 13.69.
With οὗτος and τις: ἄλλος τις οὗτος ἀνέστη Od. 20.380.

div.head: β

p.gloss: With the notion of difference obscured, someone.

div.p: With τις: μή ποτέ τις εἴπῃσι κακώτερος ἄλλος Il. 22.106: Od. 21.324.

div.head: γ
div.p: ἄλλο adverbially, app., in another matter Il. 14.249.–(τὸ) ἄλλο τόσον, for the rest to a certain extent, i.e. so farIl. 22.322, Il. 23.454.

div.head: α

p.gloss: Any other or additional person or thing.

div.p: With τις: οὐδέ τις ἄλλος ᾔδεεν Il. 18.403. Cf. Il. 23.592.

div.head: β
div.p: Another, any other or different person or thing, any one or anything else: οὐκ ἐθέλεσκες ἅμʼ ἄλλῳ ἰέναι Il. 9.486, εἴ με κελεύεις οἴκοθεν ἄλλʼ ἐπιδοῦναι Il. 23.558. Cf. Il. 14.244, Il. 16.141, Il. 23.274, etc.: οὐδέ κεν ἡμέας ἄλλο διέκρινεν (anything but death) Od. 4.179, etc.

With τις: οὔτε σοὶ οὔτε τῳ ἄλλῳ Il. 1.299, εἴ τευ ἐξ ἄλλου γένευ Il. 5.897. Cf. Il. 2.80, Il. 5.827, Il. 9.104, Il. 12.248, Il. 16.225, etc.: εἴ τίς μ' ἄλλη ἤγγειλεν Od. 23.21. Cf. Od. 7.68, Od. 6.67, Od. 9.520, Od. 10.32, etc.
Interrog.: τί σευ ἄλλος ὀνήσεται; Il. 16.31. Cf. Od. 4.649.
With τις: πῶς κέν τίς σ' ἄλλος ἵκοιτο; Od. 9.351.

div.head: γ
div.p: With the notion of difference obscured, any one, anything: οὐ σέο κύντερον ἄλλο Il. 8.483, οὐ δύναμαι γλυκερώτερον ἄλλο ἰδέσθαι Od. 9.28. Cf. Od. 11.427, Od. 15.343, 533, Od. 20.392.
With τις: οὔ τις σεῖο ὀλοώτερος ἄλλος Il. 3.365. Cf. Il. 15.569, Il. 19.321, Il. 23.439, 580: οὔ τι κύντερον ἄλλο Od. 6.216. Cf. Od. 8.32, 138, Od. 20.201, 376.

div.head: d
div.p: Every other, every one, any one, all: ὄφρα στυγέῃ ἄλλος Il. 1.186, ἄλλον κε σεῦ ἀπαλεξήσαιμι Il. 24.370, etc.: ὡς ἀπόλοιτο καὶ ἄλλος ὅτις . . . Od. 1.47, ἄλλῃ νεμεσῶ ἥ τις . . . Od. 7.286, etc.
With τις: ἵνα τις στυγέῃσιν ἄλλος Il. 8.515.

div.head: α
div.p: Another or additional: ἄλλον ὀϊστόν Il. 8.300. Cf. Il. 4.334, Il. 8.309, Il. 15.458, Il. 22.293, Il. 24.551: ἄλλην ὁδόν Od. 10.490, 563. Cf. Od. 15.449.
With τις: εἴ τίς μοι ἀνὴρ ἅμʼ ἕποιτο καὶ ἄλλος Il. 10.222. Cf. Od. 10.380, Od. 15.27.

div.head: β
div.p: Other, additional: μείζων κʼ ἄλλος χόλος ἐτύχθη (i.e. matters would have gone further) Il. 15.121.

div.head: γ
div.p: Besides, in addition: δόλον ἄλλον ὕφαινεν Il. 7.187. Cf. Il. 9.365: τέρας ἄλλο φανήτω Od. 20.101. Cf. Od. 2.93 Od. 24.128–With τις· σῆμʼ ἄλλο τι δείξω (εἴπω) Od. 21.217, Od. 23.73.

div.head: α
div.p: Another or different, some other: πρόμον Il. 6.116. Cf. Il. 3.226, Il. 6.358 = Il. 12.232, Il. 9.423, Il. 14.84, Il. 23.460: ῥάκος ἄλλο (other than his own raiment) Od. 13.434, Od. 14.342. Cf. Od. 3.243, Od. 10.392, Od. 11.127, Od. 15.518, Od. 16.9, Od. 22.6, Od. 23.186, 274.
With τις: μή τις Τρῶας ἐγείρῃσιν θεὸς ἄλλος Il. 10.511: δήμόν τι ἄλλο Od. 2.32, 44. Cf. Od. 13.325.

div.head: β
div.p: With a collective sb., the other, the rest of the . . . : λαόν Il. 11.189, etc.: δἡμῳ Od. 2.239.

div.head: α
div.p: Any other or additional: υἱὸν οὐ τέκετʼ ἄλλον Il. 5.154. Cf. Il. 19.233.
With τις: μηδέ τις ἄλλος ἴτω ἀνήρ Il. 24.148 = 177. Cf. Il. 24.505: Od. 5.179 = Od. 10.344, Od. 5.187, Od. 10.300, Od. 4.48.
Interrogatively: ἦέτιν̓ ἄλλον ἀμύντορα μερμηρίξω Od. 16.261.

div.head: β
div.p: Any other or different: οὐ θεὸς ἄλλος ἀνῷγεν Il. 14.168. Cf. Il. 7.411, Il. 10.330, Il. 23.606: ἄλλος κʼ ἀνὴρ ἵετο . . . Od. 13.333. Cf. Od. 5.104 = 138, Od. 11.623, etc.
With τις: οὐδέ τις ἄλλος ἀνὴρ ἀνέτλη Od. 10.327. Cf. Od. 21.70, etc.

div.head: γ

p.gloss: With the notion of difference obscured, merely marking a contrast.

div.p: With τις: μή τί τοι ἄλλο κακὸν μελέτω ἔργον . . . ἀλλʼ ἐδθιέμεν Od. 2.303.
Any: οὐκ ἂν ἐρίσσειε βροτὸς ἄλλος Il. 3.223. Cf. Il. 2.248: Od. 15.69, 321.

div.head: d
div.p: Every: ὄφρʼ ἄλλος πρωχὸς ἀλεύεται ἠπεροπεύειν Od. 14.400.

div.head: a
div.p: Other or additional persons or things: εἴ ποθεν ἄλλα γένοιτο Il. 9.380. Cf. Il. 6.364, Il. 22.350, etc.: τρεῖς οἱ ἄλλοι ἔδαν Od. 2.21. Cf. Il. 6.364, Il. 22.350, etc.: τρεῖς οἱ ἄλλοι ἔσαν Od. 2.21. Cf. Od. 2.166, Od. 17.422, Od. 22.62, etc.

div.head: b
div.p: Other or different persons or things, others: πάῤ ἔμοιγε καὶ ἄλλοι Il. 1.174, ἄλλων μῦθον ἄκουε Il. 2.200. Cf. Il. 1.287, Il. 3.168, Il. 4.292, Il. 5.786, Il. 23.193, etc.: ἄλλα μεμήλει Od. 1.151. Cf. Od. 2.314, Od. 4.166, Od. 6.119, Od. 9.188, Od. 11.381, Od. 14.226, etc.
With the article: τὰ ἄλλα ἄγγελός ἐσσι (in other matters) Od. 5.29, τὰ ἄλλα μετάλλα Od. 19.115. Cf. Od. 15.540, Od. 17.273, Od. 23.209.

div.head: c
div.p: The other or different persons or things, the others: ἄτερ ἥμενον ἄλλων Il. 1.498, πρόσθʼ ἄλλων Il. 4.304. Cf. Il. 2.211, Il. 3.102, Il. 5.877, Il. 12.245, 285, etc.: ἄλλοι πάντες οἴκοι ἔσαν Od. 1.11. Cf. Od. 2.209, Od. 3.33, 58, Od. 8.93, Od. 9.172, etc.

With the article: τῶν ἄλλων οὔ τις ὁρᾶτο Il. 1.198. Cf. Il. 1.465, Il. 3.73, Il. 4.429, Il. 7.41, Il. 8.211, etc.: οἰ ἄλλοι ἀθρόοι ἦσαν Od. 1.26. Cf. Od. 3.427, Od. 8.204, Od. 9.61, 331, Od. 10.132, etc.

div.head: d
div.p: All others, all men or things, all: ἔξοχον ἄλλων Il. 7.194. Cf. Il. 3.42, Il. 4.375, Il. 7.208, Il. 6.112, Il. 13.631, etc.: περὶ ἄλλων φασὶ γενέσθαι Od. 4.201. Cf. Od. 5.118, Od. 8.102, Od. 23.110, etc.
In genit. pl. after superl., as compared with all others: νείατος ἄλλων Il. 7.295. Cf. Il. 1.505, Il. 10.434, Il. 23.532: ὀϊζυρώτατον ἄλλων Od. 5.105. Cf. Od. 15.108.

div.head: e
div.p: Men: δίκας ἠδὲ θρόνιν ἄλλων Od. 3.244.

div.head: α
div.p: Other or additional: πολλοὶ ἄλλοι θῶτες ὄλοντο Od. 1.355. Cf. Od. 1.394, Od. 3.113, Od. 14.200, Od. 22.28, etc.

div.head: β
div.p: Besides, in addition: ἦ οὐχ ἅλις ἦμιν ἀλήμονές εἰσι καὶ ἄλλοι; Od. 17.376. Cf. Od. 2.65.

div.head: b
div.p: Other or different: ἄλλα δίδου γέρα Il. 9.334. Cf. Il. 17.328, Il. 23.459, 700, etc.: ἄλλα κήδεα Od. 1.244. Cf. Od. 1.374, Od. 8.558, Od. 12.22, etc.

div.head: c
div.p: The other or different: Ἀτρεΐδαι τε καὶ ἄλλοιʼ αχαιοί (ye other . . .) Il. 1.17, ἄλλοι θεοί Il. 2.1. Cf. Il. 1.22, Il. 3.68, Il. 5.524, 709, Il. 7.426, etc.: ἄλλους θεράποντας Od. 4.37. Cf. Od. 1.210, Od. 8.379, Od. 9.543, Od. 10.320, Od. 11.563, etc.

With the article: τοῖς ἄλλοισι θεοῖς Il. 1.597. Cf. Il. 2.674, Il. 11.75, 406, Il. 14.189, Il. 16.763, Il. 18.103, Il. 19.83, etc.: τῶν ἄλλων ἀνέμων Od. 5.383. Cf. Od. 7.176, Od. 9.100, Od. 10.250, Od. 11.541, Od. 16.133, etc.

div.head: d
div.p: All the other: ἀχαιῶν ἔξοχον ἄλλων Il. 17.358. Cf. Od. 4.171.
All other, all: ἄλλων νόον ἐσθλῶν Il. 9.514, etc.: εἴ τι γυναικῶν ἀλλάων περίειμι Od. 19.326, etc.

div.head: III
div.p: Of other kind or sort: οὐκ ἔα πόνος ἄλλος Il. 5.517 (i.e. it was no time for curiosity), ὄρνεον ἄλλο Il. 13.64. Cf. Il. 13.622, Il. 21.22: ἄλλῳ αὐτὸν θωτὶ ἤϊσκεν Od. 4.247. Cf. Od. 11.54.
A stranger: ἄλοχοι ἄλλοισι δαμεῖεν Il. 3.301. Cf. Il. 7.456, Il. 9.594, Il. 22.489, Il. 24.481: ἕλωρ ἄλλοισιν . 208. Cf. Od. 13.419, Od. 14.417, Od. 15.228, Od. 20.213, etc.
In apposition: ἄλλος τις πτωχὸς ἐλθών Od. 8.327.
A foe: ἀδελθεὸν ἄλλος ἔπεθνεν Od. 4.91.
In contrast with something following, an ordinary man: ἄλλος μογέων ἀποκινήσασκεν Il. 11.636.
Something not according to custom. Predicatively: ἄλλο τι τόδε περιμηχανόωνται Od. 6.200.
Something other than the true: οὐκ ἄν ἄλλα παρὲξ εἴποιμι Od. 4.348 = Od. 17.139.
Other than the right, the wrong: ἄλλην ὁδόν, ἄλλα κέλευθα Od. 9.261, ἐς ἄλλην γαῖαν Od. 13.211.

div.head: V
div.p: Implying in terms the inclusion in a class of a person or thing not in fact included in it: αὐτὸς κάθησο καὶ ἄλλους ἵδρυε λαούς Il. 2.191. Cf. Il. 5.485, 621, Il. 11.189, etc.: ʼοδυσσεὺς ἠδὲ καὶ ἄλλοι φαίηκες Od. 8.368. Cf. Od. 1.128, Od. 5.489, Od. 7.84, Od. 11.470, Od. 15.407, etc.
Repeated: ἄλλος . . . ἄλλος . . . (ἄλλος . . .), one (some) . . . another (the other, others) . . . Il. 6.473, Il. 8.429, Il. 13.730, etc.: Od. 3.26, Od. 4.692, Od. 8.169, etc.
Sim.: ἄλλος ἄλλῳ ἔρεζε θεῶν Il. 2.400. Cf. Il. 12.175, etc.: Od. 14.228, Od. 18.301, etc.– For ἄλλος ἄλλος ἄλλῃ, ἄλλοθεν ἄλλος, ἄλλοτε ἄλλος, ἄλλυδις ἄλλος, see these words.
At another time, at other times Il. 10.120, Il. 13.776, Il. 19.200, Od. 3.53, Il. 22.171, Il. 24.511.
With ἄλλος: ἀ. ἐπʼ ἄλλον (now on to one, now on to another) Il. 15.684: ἀ. ἄλλῳ (now to one, now to another) Od. 4.236.
At another time, on a former occasion: ἀ. με ῥίψεν Il. 1.590. Cf. Od. 3.90, 187.
Of or belonging to others, not one's own Od. 3.298: Od. 1.160, Od. 9.535, Od. 11.115, Od. 18.280, Od. 19.119, Od. 20.171, 221, Od. 24.301.
As if not one's own: γναθμοῖσι γελώων ἀλλοτρίοισιν Od. 20.347 (not expressing their real feelings).
Absol. in neut. pl., things of others, what is not one's own: ἀλλοτρίων χαρίσασθαι Od. 17.452. Cf. Od. 17.456, Od. 18.18.
[ a first element poss. conn. with ἠλεός + φρονέω.]
Troubled or dashed in spirit Od. 10.374.
ἀ. ἄλλος, some or part in this direction, some or part in anotherIl. 11.486, 745, Il. 12.461, Il. 17.729, Il. 21.503: Od. 5.71, Od. 7.138, Od. 14.25, 35.
Otherwise, differently, so as to bring about a different result Il. 14.53.
Reversing a previous decision: μετεβούλευσαν Od. 5.286.
In some other form: εἰ ἀ. δοίης δωτίνην Od. 9.267.
καὶ ἀ., as it is, at the best of times, without that: ἀγήνωρ ἐστὶ καὶ ἀ. Il. 9.699. Cf. Od. 3.99: Od. 8.87.
Otherwise (connoting improvement): πάρος οὐκ ἔσσεται ἀ. Il. 5.218.
In other and better wise, better, more effectually: σαωσέμεν Il. 19.401. Cf. Il. 11.391: οὔ κεν ἀ. θεὸς τεύξειεν Od. 8.176. Cf. Od. 20.211, Od. 24.107.
Otherwise than with due regard to truth, idly, at random: ἀ. ψεύδονται Od. 14.124.
With other result than that hoped for, in vain, fruitlessly: ἀ. ἠρήσατο Il. 23.144.
In pl.: περιγιγνόμεθʼ ἄλλων ἅλμασιν Od. 8.103.
To pay no heed or regard Il. 15.162, 178.
Tallow applied to a bow Od. 8.179.
Oil or grease used for dressing a hide Il. 17.390, 392.
Hog's lard or grease: συὸς ῥάχιν τεθαλυῖαν ἀλοιθῇ Il. 9.208. Cf. Il. 9.467, 32: Od. 8.476, Od. 13.410.
[sense unknown. Traditionally explained as 'daughter of the sea' (ἅλς1).]
In pl.: ἅλεσσι μεμιγμένον εἶδαρ Od. 11.123 = Od. 23.270.
A sacred grove: ʼογχηστόν, ποσιδήϊον ἀ. (i.e. O. with its grove) Il. 2.506: ʼαθήνης Od. 7.291. Cf. Od. 7.321, Od. 9.200, Od. 10.509, Od. 20.278.
Absol., to play the shirker Il. 5.253, Il. 7.443.
To get away from, effect one's escape or release from (something in which one is involved): χρέος καὶ δεσμόν (getting out of the debt and freeing himself from the bonds) Od. 8.353.
To get free from the company of: ἑταίρους Od. 12.335.

Absol., to effect one's escape, escape,
save oneself Il. 21.243, Il. 10.348, Il. 22.201: Od. 4.416, Od. 5.345, Od. 11.113 = Od. 12.140, Od. 22.460.
Not to be loosed: πέδας Il. 13.37, πεῖραρ 360: δεσμούς Od. 8.275.
To be beside oneself from pain or grief: ἀλύουσʼ ἀπεβήσετο Il. 5.352. Cf. Il. 24.12.
To manifest distraction by gestures: χερσὶν ἀλύων Od. 9.398.
3 sing. opt. ἄλθοι Od. 15.453, Od. 17.250, Od. 20.383.
To bring in, yield (a price) (always of a human chattel): ἑκατόμβοιον Il. 21.79. Cf. Od. 15.453, Od. 17.250, Od. 20.383.
Bringing (her parents many) oxen (as bride-price) Il. 18.593.
Epithet of men, gain-getting, having to labour for their bread Od. 1.349, Od. 7.8, Od. 13.261.
Barley (i.e. the prepared corn): ἀλθίτου ἀκτήν (barley-meal) Il. 11.631. Cf. Od. 2.355, Od. 14.429.
A piece of levelled or prepared ground, a garden, orchard, vincyard Il. 5.90, Il. 9.534, 540, Il. 18.57 = 438, Il. 21.36, 77, 346: Od. 7.293.
As a vineyard Il. 18.561, 566 (in both cases referring to a represenation in metal): Od. 1.193, Od. 6.122, Od. 11.193.
[σα-. Cf. ἀ-2, ἅπαξ, ἅπας, ἁπλοΐς, L. simul.]

With, along with, a person or persons, in his or their company: ἁ. ἕποντο Il. 1.424, θέρει ἁ. παῖδα Il. 7.389. Cf. Il. 3.447, Il. 4.274, Il. 9.170, Il. 10.194, Il. 11.344, etc.: κήρυχ' ἁ. ὀπάσσας Od. 9.90. Cf. Od. 2.287, 413, Od. 7.319, Od. 8.109, Od. 13.68, etc.

All or both together, in a body, without exception: πάντες ἁ. Il. 1.495, ταῦθʼ ἁ. χρὴ σπεύδειν (with united effort) Il. 13.235. Cf. Il. 1.533, Il. 7.59, Il. 8.8, Il. 15.718, Il. 18.50, etc.: ἁ. πλέομεν Od. 3.276. Cf. Od. 8.121, Od. 10.259, Od. 11.232, Od. 12.110, Od. 13.82, etc.
In reference to things, all at once, without exception: ἁ. πάνθ' ἑλέσθαι Il. 13.729. Cf. Il. 4.320.
At the same time: σκεψάμενος ἐς νἦ ἁ. καὶ μεθ' ἑταίρους Od. 12.247. Cf. Od. 10.123, Od. 18.356.
Together, at the same moment: ἁ. ἄμφω σύν ῤ̔ ἔπεσον Il. 6.255. Cf. Il. 13.613, Il. 19.242, etc.: ὁμαρτήσαντες ἁ. ἄμφω Od. 8.188.
In reference to something done while others are doing other things: τῇ ἁ. ʼα. κλισίην ἔθηκεν, ʼα. δὲ . . . φ. δὲ . . . Od. 4.123.

At the same time, besides, too, also: ἁ. δ' ἄλλ' ἀποδάσσεσθαι Il. 22.117. Cf. Il. 24.304: Od. 19.376.–ἁ. . . . καὶ . . . , both . . . and . . . : ἁ. πρόσσω καὶ ὀπίσσω Il. 1.343. Cf. Il. 2.707, Il. 13.299, etc.: Od. 3.111, Od. 19.471, etc.

div.head: II
div.p: Prep. with dat. (freq. following the case).
With, along with, in company with: ἁ. ἡγεμόνεσσιν Il. 3.1. Cf. Il. 1.158, 226, 251, Il. 2.249, 524, etc.: τῷ ἁ. πομπὸν ἕπεσθαι Od. 4.162. Cf. Od. 1.98, 331, 428, Od. 2.11, Od. 3.359, etc.

At the same time with, at the time of: ἁ. ἠελίῳ καταδύντι Il. 1.592. Cf. Il. 6.331, Il. 9.618, Il. 11.685, Il. 18.136, Il. 24.600, etc.: ἁ. ὴοῖ Od. 4.407. Cf. Od. 7.31, Od. 12.24, Od. 14.266, Od. 16.2, Od. 23.362, etc.
To level with the dust, destroy: πόλιν Il. 9.593.
Thus, of very great size or height: χίμαιραν Il. 7.179, Il. 16.329: ἱστὸν νηός Od. 14.311.
Of young animals, tender, feeble: ἄρνα Il. 22.310: σκυλάκεσσιν Od. 20.14.
3 sing. impf. ἡμάρτανε Il. 10.372, Il. 24.68: Od. 11.511.
Fut. infin. in mid. form ἁμαρτήσεσθαι Od. 9.512.
To discharge a missile vainly, miss one's aim: ἤμβροτες οὐδ' ἔτυχες Il. 5.287. Cf. Il. 8.311, Il. 11.233 = Il. 13.605, Il. 13.518, Il. 22.279.
Sim., to miss (a person) in throwing something to be caught Od. 7.116.
Sim., to lose (a person) by death Il. 22.505.
To fall short, be lacking or deficient in.

With genit.: δώρων (failed to give in due measure) Il. 24.68: νοήματος ἐσθλοῦ (failed in the matter of) Od. 6.292, μύθων (failed in finding in the matter of) Od. 6.292, μύθων (failed in finding the right) Od. 11.511.
To commit wrong, sin: ὅτε κέν τις ἁμάρτῃ Il. 9.501. Cf. Od. 13.214, Od. 8.155.
To neglect one's duty: τόδε γ' ἤμβροτον (in this) Od. 22.154.
Both or all together: δούρατʼ ἤϊξαν Il. 5.656, ῥήσσοντες Il. 18.571.
At the same moment, simultaneously Il. 21.162: Od. 22.81.
A coming of wheels together, a coming of chariots abreast of each other Il. 23.422.
To reap, act as reaper Il. 18.551.
To slice off: ἀπʼ οὔατʼ ἀμήσαντες Od. 8.301.
In mid. : ἐν ταλάροισιν ἀμησάμενος Od. 9.247.
Capable of being scaled: πόλις Il. 7.434: οὐρανός Od. 11.316.
Lifting up the voice Il. 22.476. (Cf. ἀνεβάλλετʼ ἀείδειν under ἀναβάλλω 2.)
Spirting up: λέβης ζεῖ ἀ. Il. 21.364.
The food of the gods Od. 5.93, 199, Od. 9.359, Od. 12.63.
By Here as a cleansing (and doubtless perfuming) cosmetic Il. 14.170.
Applied by divine agency as a preservative or for purification to the corpse of Sarpedon Il. 16.670, 680.
Introduced by divine agency into the corpse of Patroclus Il. 19.38.

Sweet-smelling, fragrant: χαῖται Il. 1.529, νύκτα Il. 2.57 (prob. referring to the fragrance of a still warm night), ὕπνος Il. 2.19 (prob. a transference of epithet from νύξ). Cf. Il. 5.338, 369, Il. 8.434, Il. 10.41, 142, Il. 13.35, Il. 14.172, 177, 178, Il. 18.268, Il. 21.507, Il. 23.187 (here no doubt with a reference to preservative properties of the divine food; cf. ἀμβροσίη 2), Il. 24.341, 363: =Od. 1.97 = Od. 5.45, Od. 4.429 = 574, Od. 6.283, Od. 9.404, Od. 15.8, Od. 18.193.
-ον. = ἀμβρόσιος.: εἵματα Il. 16.670, 680: Od. 6.260, 265, Od. 24.59, ἐλαίῳ Od. 8.365, νύξ Od. 11.330.
Of or belonging to a god, divine Il. 5.339, 870: Od. 5.347.
App., conferring divine qualities: δῶρα Od. 18.191.

p.gloss: Not to be envied or desired.

div.p: Of a person in depreciation, miserable, wretched Od. 17.219, Od. 8.362.
The rafters, sloping to each other in pairs, of a pitched roof Il. 23.712 (the wrestlers, with shoulders together but standing wide apart with their feet, being compared with a pair).
3 sing. aor. mid. ἠμείψατο Il. 23.542. ἀμείψατο Il. 4.403.
Infin. ἀμείψασθαι Il. 23.489: Od. 2.83, Od. 4.286, Od. 16.91. (ἀπ-, ἐπ-, παρ-.)
With genit. of what is taken in exchange: τεύχεα πρὸς διομήδεα χρύσεα χαλκείων Il. 7.235.
Sim., to exchange (the support of) one thing for (that of) another: γόνυ γουνός Il. 11.547.
To cause persons to exchange: τεύχεα Il. 14.381.

div.head: a
div.p: To requite: εὖ σε δώροισιν ἀμειψάμενος (making a good return to you in gifts) Od. 24.285.

div.head: b
div.p: To take turns with one another: ἀμειβόμενοι θυλακὰς ἔχον Il. 9.471.

So ἀμειβόμεναι ὀπὶ καλῇ (taking up the strain from each other) Il. 1.604: Od. 24.60.– ἀμειβόμενοι κατὰ οἴκους (each in turn giving the feast in his house) Od. 1.375 = Od. 2.140.– ταρθἔ ἀμειβομένω (with frequent change (from side to side)) Od. 8.379.

div.head: c
div.p: To pass from one position or place to another: ἄλλοτ' ἐπ̓ ἄλλον [ἵππον] ἀμείβεται Il. 15.684.

div.head: d
div.p: To pass from, leave, quit: ἕρκος ὀδόντων Il. 9.409.

div.head: g
div.p: To speak in answer, make answer Il. 13.823, Il. 23.489, 492, Il. 24.200, 424: Od. 3.148, Od. 4.382, 484, Od. 7.67, etc.
In pres. pple. ἀμειβόμενος, -η, making answer, in answerIl. 3.437, Il. 6.356, Il. 14.270, etc.: Od. 2.84, Od. 4.234, 375, etc.
Inflexible, implacable, relentless: ʼαΐδης Il. 9.158, ἦτορ 572, ἄνακτος Il. 24.734.
Acc. sing. masc. and fem. ἀμείνω Il. 3.11, Il. 4.400, Il. 9.423.
Used as comp. of ἀγαθός or ἐσθλός.
Better, more worthy, serviceable or skilful: ἀγορῇ Il. 4.400. Cf. Il. 7.350, Il. 18.106, Il. 23.315, 479, 605 (your betters): Od. 2.180, Od. 6.51, Od. 22.156.
In reference to personal appearance Od. 24.374.

Of things or abstractions, better of their kind, better, more excellent, helpful or in place: ὀμίχλην νυκτὸς ἀμείνω Il. 3.11. Cf. Il. 1.116, Il. 6.358 = Il. 12.232, Il. 9.104, 256, 423, Il. 12.412, Il. 14.107, Il. 15.509: ἀμείνω αἴσιμα πάντα Od. 6.310, Od. 15.71. Cf. Od. 1.376 = Od. 2.141, Od. 5.364, Od. 14.466, Od. 22.374.
Impers. with infin.: πείθεσθαι ἄμεινόν [ἐστιν] Il. 1.274. Cf. Il. 11.469: Od. 22.104.
Good rather than ill: οὔ οἱ τό γ' ἄμεινον Il. 24.52.
In pass. with the milk in acc.: ἀμελγόμεναι γάλα Il. 4.434.
To disregard the claims of, fail to aid: οὐκ ἀμέλησε κασιγνήτοιο Il. 8.330. Cf. Il. 13.419.
In sinister sense of holding back from attempting to despoil Il. 17.9.
To disregard, fail to carry out: ἐθημοσύνης Il. 17.697.
Of ghosts, fleeting, feeble Od. 10.521, 536, Od. 11.29, 49.
To deprive of efficiency or effect: αἰχμήν Il. 13.562.
2 sing. aor. subj. pass. ἀμερθῇς Il. 22.58.
To deprive of or debar from.
With genit.: αἰῶνος Il. 22.58. Cf. Od. 8.64, Od. 8.290.
To deprive of lustre, tarnish Od. 19.18.
Immeasurable, endless: πένθος Od. 19.512, πόνος Od. 23.249.
Unmeasured in words. Of Thersites Il. 2.212.
Unmanageable, difficult to deal with: ἀ. παραρρητοῖσι πιθέσθαι (in that you will not listen to persuasion) Il. 13.726.
Against which no contrivance a vails Il. 8.130 = Il. 11.310.
Impracticable, not to be attempted Il. 14.262.
Difficult to deal with or expound: ὄνειροι Od. 19.560.
Wearing no μίτρη with the χιτών, not wearing theμίτρη Il. 16.419.
Thus, misty, steaming. Of Lemnos Il. 24.753. (Lemnos is not volcanic. The reference may be to some jet of natural gas which has now disappeared.)
App., what (of good) fate does not bestow, ill fortune Od. 20.76.
Denied the just dues of mankind, ill - fated Il. 7.408, Il. 24.773.

p.gloss: Having no share in, not entering.

div.p: With genit.: λοετρῶν ʼωκεανοῖο Il. 18.489: = Od. 5.275.
A vessel for collecting the blood of a sacrificial victim Od. 3.444.
From any point (of a narrative): τῶν ἁ. εἰπέ Od. 1.10.
Of a garment, kept for a change (= ἐπημοιβός 1): χλαῖνα Od. 14.521.
A return or requital: ἄξιον ἔσται ἀμοιβῆς (will bring a (full) return) Od. 1.318, ἑκατόμβης (for . . . ) Od. 3.58.
Compensation: βοῶν (for the loss of . . . ) Od. 12.382.
A relieving force: ἦλθον ἀμοιβοί (as a . . . ) Il. 13.793.

gen. rendered, in the depth or gloom of night Il. 11.173, Il. 15.324, Il. 22.28, 317: Od. 4.841. (But Sirius, referred to in Il. 22.27 as shining ὀπώρης, is not then seen in the depth of night; and ἀστὴρ ἕσπερος in Il. 22.317 also causes difficulty.)

-ή, -όν. Our ( = ἡμέτερος) Il. 7.414, Il. 8.178, Il. 10.448, Il. 13.96, Il. 16.830: Od. 11.166 = 481. (But the sense my (cf. ἡμέτερος 2) is always admissible, and in Il. 7.414, and perh. in Il. 8.178, is preferable.)
In neut. ἄμοτον as adv., insatiably, continually, incessantly, without pause or intermission Il. 4.440, Il. 5.518, Il. 13.40, 80, Il. 19.300, Il. 22.36, Il. 23.567: Od. 7.83, Od. 17.520.
Nom. pl. masc. aor. pple. ἀμπείραντες.
Epithet of places Il. 2.561, Il. 3.184, Il. 9.152 = 294.
With διά (cf. διαμπερές): διὰ δ' ἀ. ἰὸς κατέπηκτο Il. 11.377. Cf. Il. 17.309: Od. 21.422.
To leap up, start up: ἐκ λόχου ἀμπήδησεν Il. 11.379.
A diadem of metal worn over the forehead Il. 22.469.
Together, all together, in or into a body or mass: θυνόντων ἀ. Il. 10.524. Cf. Il. 9.6, Il. 10.300, Il. 12.385, Il. 13.336, 343, Od. 3.114, 158, 374, Il. 23.217: Od. 4.659, Od. 12.413.
Together, at the same time: ἀ. βρόντησε καὶ ἔμβαλε κεραυνόν Od. 12.415 = Od. 14.305. Cf. Od. 5.467.

An epithet of persons of general commendation, noble, illustrious, goodly, or the like: μάντις Il. 1.92, Αἰθιοπῆας 423. Cf. Il. 2.674, Il. 5.247, Il. 7.155, Il. 11.835, Od. 3.236, etc.: Αἰγίσθοιο (app. as a merely conventional epithet) Od. 1.29, Ὀδυσῆος Od. 2.225. Cf. Od. 4.187, Od. 6.29, Od. 8.117, Od. 19.332, Od. 8.325, etc.
Of women: ἄκοιτιν Il. 7.374. Cf. Od. 4.4, Od. 6.303, Od. 13.42, Od. 15.15, etc.

Sim. of things or abstractions, indicating excellence or perfection: πομπῇ Il. 7.171, ἔργα Il. 9.128, τόξῳ Il. 15.463. Cf. Il. 9.270, Il. 10.19, Il. 13.637, Il. 16.119, Il. 19.245, Il. 23.263: οἶκος Od. 1.232, μῆτις Od. 9.414. Cf. Od. 10.50, Od. 12.261, Od. 14.508, Od. 16.237, Od. 22.442 = 459, Od. 23.145, Od. 24.80, 278.
Absol. in neut. pl.: δς ἂν ἀμύμονα εἰδῇ (is of noble heart) (see εἴδω III.12) Od. 19.332.
3 sing. impf. ἄμυνε Il. 13.678, Il. 14.71, Il. 15.731.
Aor. opt. mid. ἀμυναίμην Od. 2.62, Od. 12.114. (ἀπ-, ἐπ-, προσ-.)
To defend oneself against, fight with: δήϊον ἄνδρα Il. 22.84.

With dat. of person or thing protected: ἡμῖν λοιγόν Il. 1.67. Cf. Il. 1.341, 398, 456, Il. 4.129, Il. 9.435, 495, Il. 11.277, 588, Il. 12.334, Il. 13.426, Il. 15.736, Il. 16.32, 512, 835, Il. 17.511, Il. 18.129, Od. 3.124: ἄστεϊ νηλεὲς ἦμαρ Od. 8.525.
With genit. : κῆρας παιδός Il. 12.402. Cf. Il. 4.11, Il. 15.731, Il. 16.75, 80.
To defend, protect, succour, fight for, come to the rescue of.
With genit.: οὗ παιδός Il. 16.522. Cf. Il. 13.109.
Absol. to play the defender, fight, show fight: ἐξελθεῖν καὶ ἀμῦναι Il. 9.576. Cf. Il. 13.312, 678, 814, Il. 17.182: οὐ τοῖοι ἀμυνέμεν Od. 2.60.

div.head: a
div.p: To ward or keep off from oneself: ἀμύνετο νηλεὲς ἦμαρ Il. 11.484, Il. 13.514. Cf. Il. 17.510.
Sim. ἄνδρας θηρητῆρας ἀμύνονται πεπρὶ τέκνων Il. 12.170.
To defend oneself against, fight with: σκύλλην Od. 12.114.

div.head: b
div.p: With genit.: καλυδῶνος Il. 9.531. Cf. Il. 12.155, 179, Il. 16.561.

div.head: c
div.p: Absol., to play the defender, fight: περὶ νηῶν Il. 12.142. Cf. Il. 12.227, 243, Il. 15.496, Il. 16.556, 622, Il. 18.173, Il. 24.500: ἧός μοι ἀμύνεσθαι πάρʼ ὀϊστοί Od. 22.106. Cf. Od. 2.62, Od. 22.116.
To tear, lacerate: χερσὶ στήθεα Il. 19.284.
To welcome (with suppressed notion of embracing) Od. 14.381.
To show love to, treat with affection.
In mid., to come together or gather round.
With acc.: θεαί μιν ἀμφαγέροντο Il. 18.37.
Openly, without concealment: μὴ ἀ. ἔργα γένοιτο (disclosure should take place) Od. 19.391.
Adv. of acc. fem. form ἀμφαδίην = ἀμφαδά. Il. 6.196, Il. 13.356: Od. 5.120.
Openly, without concealment or subterfuge: βαλέειν Il. 6.243, ἀγορευέμεν Il. 9.370: ἠὲ δόλῳ ἢ ἀ. Od. 1.296, Od. 11.120, ἢ ἀ. ἦε κρυφηδόν Od. 14.330 = Od. 19.299.
To rattle or ring about one: τεύχεʼ ἀμφαράβησεν Il. 21.408.
Speechlessness: ἀ. μιν λάβεν Il. 17.695: = Od. 4.704.
To put the hands round, handle.
In mid.: [ὅρμον] ἀμφαφόωντο Od. 15.462. Cf. Od. 19.475.
So μαλακώτερος ἀμφαφάασθαι (easier to deal with) Il. 22.373.
To handle and use: τόξον Od. 19.586.
To put the hands on in passing round: κοῖλον λόχον (the wooden horse) Od. 4.277.
Absol., to feel about with the hands Od. 8.196.
To come round, be diffused round.
With acc. : ἀϋτή με Od. 7.122, ἀϋτμή με Od. 12.369.
Covering on both sides: θαρέτρην (i.e. enclosing (the arrows)) Il. 1.45.
In neut. qualifying a vague notion the state of things; hence, a dead heat: ἀμφήριστόν κʼ ἔθηκεν Il. 23.382, 527.

div.head: a
div.p: On both sides: ἀ. ὀβελοῖσιν ἔπειραν (so that the spits appeared on both sides) Il. 1.465 = Il. 2.428. Cf. Il. 9.210: ξύλα τʼ ἀ. καὶ οἰσέμεν ὕδωρ (i.e. to be set on either side of the altar) Od. 3.429. Cf. Od. 3.462 = Od. 12.365 = Od. 14.430, Od. 14.75.

div.head: b
div.p: In reference to the two sides of the body: ἀ. ὄσσε νὺξ ἐκάλυψεν (both eyes) Il. 5.310 = Il. 11.356. Cf. Il. 7.117, Il. 10.535, etc.: δρεψαμένω ἀ. δειράς Od. 2.153. Cf. Od. 9.389.
Sim. in reference to the φρένες (see μέλας 1): μένεος φρένες ἀ. μελαιναι πίμπλαντο Il. 1.103: = Od. 4.661. Cf. Il. 17.83, 499, 573.
From side to side: ἀ. μοι χεὶρ ὀδύνῃσιν ἐλήλαται Il. 16.517.
Round, about, round about: ἔστασαν Il. 4.330. Cf. Il. 4.328, Il. 5.194, Il. 6.449, Il. 11.417, Il. 14.420, etc.: χλαίνας βάλον Od. 4.50. Cf. Od. 3.32, Od. 4.253, Od. 5.72, Od. 6.14, Od. 9.22, etc.
Fig.: ἀ. μάλα θράζεσθε (look at the matter all round, consider well) Il. 18.254.
About or concerning something: τάδ' ἀ. πονησόμεθα Il. 23.159. Cf. Il. 6.316, Il. 11.776: τὸνδέρον ἀ. θ' ἕπον Od. 8.61, Od. 19.421.

div.head: a
div.p: On each side of: ἀ. κῦμα στείρῃ ἴαχεν Il. 1.481, ἀ. ὤμοισιν βάλετο ξίθος (i.e. the belt rested on both shoulders) Il. 2.45, θώρηκας ῥήξειν ἀ. στήθεσσιν (i.e. the belt rested on both shoulders) Il. 2.45, θώρηκας ῥήξειν ἀ. στήθεσσιν (i.e. the two γύαλα) 544, ἀ. ὀχέεσσι βάλε κύκλα Il. 5.722, ἀ. σθοῖς ὀχέεσσιν (app., sprawling over them) Il. 18.231, ἀ. πυρίποδα (astraddle over it) 344, etc.: ἀ. ἑνὶ δούρατι βαῖνεν (bestriding it) Od. 5.371, ἀ. πυπὶ χαλκὸν ἰήνατε Od. 8.426, etc.
So with locative: ἱδρώσει τελαμὼν ἀ. στήθεσθιν Il. 2.388.
In reference to a shield protecting on both sides (cf. ἀμφίβροτος): δῄουν ἀ. στήθεσσι βοείας Il. 5.452. Cf. Il. 10.149 (across the shoulders), Il. 11.527, Il. 16.108, Il. 17.132, etc.
For βαίνειν ἀ. τινι see βαίνω I.6.a, and cf. ἀμφιβαίνω 4.

div.head: b
div.p: Round, about, round about: τυθωέϊ Il. 2.782, εἰδώλῳ Il. 5.451. Cf. Il. 9.654, Il. 13.496, Il. 14.447, Il. 15.608, etc.: πόλει Od. 7.9, γούνασιν Od. 6.142. Cf. Od. 4.245, Od. 10.262, Od. 11.423, Od. 14.23, etc.
So with locative: ἀ. κυνέην κεθαλῆθιν ἔθηκεν Il. 10.257. Cf. Il. 10.261: Od. 16.145.
In reference to something transfixing: ἀ. σιδήρῳ Il. 23.30. Cf. Od. 12.395.
With notion of protection: ἀ. βόεσσιν Il. 15.587. Cf. Il. 17.369.

div.head: c
div.p: About, con cerning, for, touching, in the matter of: Ἑλένῃ Il. 3.70. Cf. Il. 3.254, Il. 6.408, Il. 11.672, Il. 13.382, Il. 16.647, etc.: τεύχεσιν ἀ. Ἀχιλῆος Od. 11.546. Cf. Od. 1.48, Od. 4.151, Od. 14.338, Od. 17.555, Od. 22.227, etc.

div.head: a
div.p: On each side of : ἀ. κῆρ Il. 16.481.

div.head: b
div.p:
Round, about, round about: ἀ. ἅλα(i.e. round the bay) Il. 1.409, ἀ. αἴαντε (with them, under their leadership) Il. 7.436, τὴν ἑτέρην πόλιν ἀ. Il. 18.509. Cf. Il. 2.417, Il. 3.231, Il. 5.314, Il. 13.335, Il. 16.290, Il. 17.290, Il. 22.473, etc.:
ʼιαρδάνου ἀ. ῥέεθρα Od. 3.292. Cf. Od. 3.163, Od. 8.502, Od. 11.419, Od. 17.65, Od. 22.281, Od. 24.37, etc.
Joined with περί Il. 2.305, Il. 17.760.–οἱ ἀ. τινα, a person and those with him, a group of which the person named is the chief: οἱ δʼ ἀ. Ἀτρεΐωνα ἠγερέθοντο Il. 23.233.
Sim.: οὓς ἑτάρους στέλλοντʼ ἀ. πελάγοντα Ἀλάστορά τε . . .δ 295 (where P. etc. are included in ὲτάρους).

div.head: c
div.p: With genit., about, concerning: μάχεσθον πίδακος ἀ. Il. 16.825. Cf. Od. 8.267.
Epithet of Ithaca Od. 1.386, 395, 401, Od. 2.293, Od. 8.252.
Acc. fem. pf. pple. without redup. ἀμφιαχυῖαν (ἀμφι-ϝακυῖαν).
Of a bird, to cry (flying) about: τὴν λάβεν ἀμφιαχυῖαν Il. 2.316.
3 sing. plupf. ἀμφιβεβήκει Il. 8.68, Il. 16.777: Od. 9.198.
To be round, cover completely, a double (organ) (cf. ἀμφί I.1.b).
With acc.: πόνος (ἄχος) φρένας ἀμφιβέβηκεν Il. 6.355: Od. 8.541.
With dat.: Τρώων νέφος νηυσίν Il. 16.66.

p.gloss: To be round, envelop, cover up.

div.p: To have the feet on each side of, bestride (cf. βαίνω I.6.a).
With acc. Fig.: ἠέλιος μέσον οὐρανόν (thought of as standing with both feet in the midst of heaven) Il. 8.68, Il. 16.777: Od. 4.400.
Hence to protect (a place) as a tutelary power Il. 1.37 = 451: Od. 9.198.
Aor. pple. ἀμφιβαλών, -όντος Il. 17.742, Il. 23.97: Od. 17.344, Od. 23.192.
Fig., to throw or put (strength) on both sides of something, apply (strength) vigorously: μένοσἀμφιβαλόντες Il. 17.742.
In mid., to throw (a garment) round oneself Od. 7.178.
To put on a piece of armour Od. 22.103.
Defence of a fallen body (cf. ἀμφιβαίνω 4): Τρώων (by the . . .) Il. 5.623.

p.gloss: Protecting on both sides (as well as in front).

div.p: Epithet of shields Il. 2.389, Il. 11.32, Il. 12.402, Od. 3.281.
[prob. ἀμφι- 2 + γυ-, to bend, as in γύαλον, γυρός.]

p.gloss: Thus, having a crooked limb on each side.

div.p: Thus, of spears, (having a head) curved on each side, i.e. leafshaped; or perh., bending to either side, elastic Il. 13.147 = Il. 15.278 = Il. 17.731, Il. 14.26 = Il. 16.637, Il. 15.386, 712: Od. 16.474, Od. 24.527.
With acc. Fig.: ἀϋτὴ ἄστυ ἀμφιδέδηε Il. 7.329.

To set round in circles, i.e. in strips running round: ᾧ πέρι χεῦμα κασσιτέροιο ἀμφιδεδίνηται Il. 23.562 (the strips on the front plate being app. continued on the back plate and carried round to the front again): κολεὸν ἐλέθαντος ἀμφιδεδίνηται (is surrounded by (a succession of) ivory rings) Od. 8.405.
Having both cheeks torn in mourning: ἄλοχος Il. 2.700.
Both torn in mourning: παρειαί Il. 11.393.
To put (garments) on a person Od. 5.167, 264, Od. 15.369, Od. 18.361.
In mid., to put (garments) on oneself Od. 23.131, 142.
With elision of the ι. (on the loss of the .σ)
3 sing. impf. ἄμθεπε Il. 17.124, Il. 18.348: Od. 8.437.
To handle, attend to, do what is needful to: ἵππους Il. 19.392. Cf. Il. 5.667, Il. 18.559, Il. 23.167, Il. 24.622.
To marshal, draw up in order Il. 2.525.

p.gloss: In sinister sense, to employ oneself about for evil, work for the destruction of,

div.p: Of fire, to bring itself to bear upon, lap round: πρύμνην Il. 16.124. Cf. Il. 18.348: = Od. 8.437.

p.gloss: To settle about, be deposited upon.

div.p: Absol., one who has both parents alive Il. 22.496.
3 sing. subj. ἀμφικαλύψῃ Od. 8.511, Od. 13.183, Od. 20.86.
To cover both of one's . . . (cf. ἀμφί I.1

div.head: b
div.p: ). Of sleep: βλέθαρʼ ἀμφικαλύψας Od. 5.493. Cf. Od. 20.86, Od. 23.17.
To cover completely a double (organ) (cf. ἀμφί I 1.b): ἔρως φρένας ἀμφεκάλυψεν Il. 3.442, Il. 14.294.
To cover up all round, enfold, conceal, contain Il. 2.262, Il. 23.91.
Of a city, to receive withing its walls Od. 8.511.

Of a house, to receive as a guest
Od. 4.618 = Od. 15.118.
Fig. of death or fate Il. 5.68, Il. 12.116, Il. 16.350, Od. 3.417: Od. 4.180.

p.gloss: To put round, cover or protect with.

div.p: With dat. of what is covered or protected: σἀκος οἱ Il. 8.331 = Il. 13.420. Cf. Il. 14.343: Od. 14.349.
Sim., to put round (something) so as to isolate (it): ὄρος πόλει Od. 8.569, Od. 13.152, 158, 177, 183.
With acc.: τὸ μέλαν δρυὸς ἀμφικεάσσας (splitting off (the outside wood) all round the dark heart) Od. 14.12.
With foliage all round, thick-leafed: θάμνῳ Il. 17.677.
[ἀμφι- 1 (giving the notion of hesitation between two sides, hence of doubtfulness) + *λύκη = L. lux.]
To carry the hands all round or over (the surface of), wipe all round or over: τραπέζας Od. 20.152.
With acc., in local sense, to fight round or about: ̓́ιλιον Il. 7.461. Cf. Il. 9.412, Il. 16.73, Il. 18.208.
With genit., to fight for the possession of: τείχεος Il. 15.391. Cf. Il. 16.496 = 533, Il. 18.20.
To resound or echo all round Od. 10.227.
In mid., to have one's lot, dwell, round or about.
To smooth all round: κορμόν Od. 23.196.
To busy oneself about, attend to Il. 13.656, Il. 19.278.
To treat surgically Il. 4.220, Il. 16.28: Od. 19.455.
In sinister sense: ʼαστεροπαῖον ἐγχέλυες ἀμφεπένοντο (made a meal of him) Il. 21.203. Cf. Il. 23.184.
With dat. Fig., in pass., to be put round as a crown, adorn: οὔ οἱ χάρις ἀμφιπεριστέθεται ἐπέεσσιν Od. 8.175.
To turn about in all directions: ἵππους Il. 8.348.
To fall (with the arms) round, embrace.
To busy oneself about, take care of, tend: ἐμὸν βίον Od. 18.254 = Od. 19.127, ὄρχατον Od. 24.244, 257.
In sinister sense: ἔδοσαν ἐρινύσιν ἀμφιπολεύειν (i.e. handed them over to their tender mercies) Od. 20.78.

A handmaid, a female attendant or servant, hardly to be distinguished from δμῳή. (The words are sometimes used indifferently; cf. Od. 7.52 with 307, and 84 with 99. But in Od. 22.483, 484 ἀμφίπολοι seem to be personal attendants and δμῳαί the other servants.) Il. 3.143, 422, Il. 7.286, 324, 372, 399, 491, 499, Il. 18.417 (i.e. representations), Il. 22.442, 461, Il. 24.304: Od. 1.136, Od. 7.18, Od. 6.232, Od. 18.198, Od. 19.90, Od. 23.227, etc.
With word indicating the servant's country of origin: σικελή Od. 24.366.
To busy oneself about, attend to: τάθον Od. 20.307.
To do the offices of a second to: εὐρύαλον Il. 23.681.
To fly round and round Il. 2.315.
Flowed round (by the sea), sea-girt Od. 1.50, 198, Od. 11.325, Od. 12.283.
On both sides: ᾧ ῥόπαλ' ἀ. ἐάγῃ (i.e. across his back) Il. 11.559, δούρασιν ὰ. [βάλεν] (with spears from both hands, with both spears at once) Il. 21.162.

A part, asunder: ἀ. θράζονται (have different views) Il. 2.13 = 30 = 67, ἔχουσα ἀ. (one in each scale) Il. 12.434, τόξων ἀϊκὰς ἀ. μένον (at a safe distance) Il. 15.709, ἀ. ἀρωγοί (partisans, some of one, some of the other) Il. 18.502, ἀ. ἀριζήλω (standing out from the others) 519, ἀ. ἄλλ' ἀποδάσσεσθαι (in addition) Il. 22.117, ἀ. ὁδοῦ Il. 23.393 (see ὁδός 1). Cf. Il. 13.345, 706: ζυγὸν ἀ. ἔχοντες (supporting it at either end) Od. 3.486 = Od. 15.184, τιμὴν ἀ. ἄγοντες (in addition) Od. 22.57. Cf. Od. 1.54.
Sim. of separation from a person Od. 19.221.
Between: ὀλίγη ἦν ἀ. ἄρουρα (between the heaps or rows) Il. 3.115.
Round, about: τάθρος ἀ. ἐοῦσα (surrounding) Il. 6.342, τάρταρος ἀ. [ἐστιν] Il. 8.481. Cf. Il. 9.464, Il. 14.123, Il. 23.330, Il. 24.488: Od. 8.340, 476.

div.head: a
div.p: Apart from, at a distance from: διός Il. 8.444. Cf. Od. 14.352, Od. 16.267.

div.head: b
div.p: About, concerning: ἅρματος ἀ. ἰδών (seeing to it) Il. 2.384.
With dat., round, about: ἄξονι Il. 5.723.

div.head: a
div.p: On each side of: δύο δ' ἀ. ἕκαστον [δίθρον] (one on each side of each) Il. 11.748.

div.head: b
div.p: Round, about: ἕκαστον Il. 11.634. Cf. Il. 14.274, Il. 15.225: Od. 7.266, Od. 6.4, Od. 9.399.
In aor. and mid., to stand round or about Il. 18.233, Il. 23.695, Il. 24.712.
Thus, twisted about: κεθαλαὶ τρεῖς δράκοντος ἀμφιστρεθέες Il. 11.40 (i.e. two twisted about the third).
Aor. fem. pple. pass. ἀμφιτεθεῖσα Il. 10.271.
To put round or about something Il. 10.271.
In mid., to put on, arm oneself with: ξίθος Od. 8.431 (i.e. the belt rested on both shoulders).
With two θάλοι: κυνέην Il. 5.743 = Il. 11.41.
A two-handled jar Il. 23.92, 170: Od. 2.290, 349, 379, Od. 9.164, 204, Od. 13.105 (of natural formations in a cave), Od. 24.74.
With acc.: ἐμὲ κήρ (gaped for me) Il. 23.79.
3 sing. aor. pass. ἀμφέχυτο Il. 2.41. ἀμφθεχύθη Od. 4.716.
To pour or shed round or about. Of dust: πάρος κόνιν ἀμφιχυθῆναι (had settled down again) Il. 23.764.
Fig., in pass., of sound, to come round.
With acc.: ἀμφέχυτό μιν ὀμθή Il. 2.41.
Of sleep, to be shed round one, come upon one Il. 14.253 Il. 23.63.
With acc.: τη̣̣ αχος ἀμφεχύθη Od. 4.716.
So of a bodily action, to embrace (a person): ἀμφιχυθεὶς πατέρα Od. 16.214. Cf. Od. 22.498.
Poured round or about; hence of heaped-up earth: τεῖχος Od. 3.145.

div.head: a
div.p: Of two persons, etc. In dual or (more freq.) in pl.

div.head: α
div.p: Absol.: ἐξαίνυτο θυμὸν ἀμφοτέρω Il. 5.156. Cf. Il. 3.208, Il. 4.38, Il. 5.261, Il. 6.3, etc.: ἀμφοτέρυς ἱέρευσεν Od. 14.74. Cf. Od. 3.37, Od. 11.212, Od. 18.17, Od. 8.214, etc.

div.head: β
div.p: With sb. or pron.: ἀμφοτέρω σθῶϊ Il. 6.280, ἐπ̓ ἀμφοτέρους πόδας (one after the other) Il. 13.281. Cf. Il. 4.521, Il. 5.163, Il. 8.115, Il. 12.382, etc.: ἀμφοτέρῃσιν χερσίν Od. 4.116. Cf. Od. 3.136, Od. 4.282, Od. 5.414, Od. 12.239, etc.
With sb. to be supplied: ἀμφοτέρῃσι
[χερσίν], with both hands Il. 5.416: Od. 10.264, Od. 11.594, Od. 17.356, Od. 18.28.

div.head: b
div.p: In pl. of two groups of persons.

div.head: α
div.p: Absol.: ἀμφοτέρων βέλεα Il. 8.67. Cf. Il. 3.416, Il. 4.16, Il. 7.120, Il. 13.303, etc.: φιλότητα μετ' ἀμφοτέροισιν Od. 24.476. Cf. Od. 10.204, Od. 24.546.
In neut. ἀμφότερον as adv., both. Followed by . . . τε . . . τε Il. 3.179, Il. 4.145.
From both sides: ὦρτ' ἀϋτὴ ἀ. Il. 15.313. Cf. Il. 12.431.
Of plainting strands of a rope, across and across Od. 10.167.
On both sides, on either side: πλῆμναί εἰσιν ἀ. Il. 5.726. Cf. Il. 12.55, Il. 16.563, Il. 17.440, Od. 3.170, Il. 23.628: Od. 22.404.
On both edges: ἀ. ἀκαχμένον Od. 5.235, Od. 22.80.
At both ends: ἅψας ἀ. Od. 8.408.
Of stating alternatives: ἐρέω ἀ. Od. 12.58.
In both directions: θόως γένετ' ἀ. Il. 15.669.
With περί, app., in both directions so as to meet: περὶ ἕρκος ἐλήλαται ἀ. Od. 6.113. Cf. Od. 10.88.
In both directions: γεγωνέμεν ἀ. Il. 8.223 = Il. 11.6, ἀ. λίθοι πωτῶντο Il. 12.287.
App., by the middle: ἀ. ἀείρας Od. 17.237.
Only in nom. and acc. of same form. Both. Constructed with dual or pl.
Of two groups of persons: ἀριθμηθήμεναι ἀ. Il. 2.124.
